en-mt: There is no vaccine for COVID-19, but many organizations are working to make it available.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: Kosokola maboko esengami mpona kopekisa ete malady epanzana na bato.
en-mt: Hand washing is required to prevent the spread of disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: CDC esengi bato basokola maboko ba mbala ebele na sabuni na mayi mpona baseconde ntuku mibale, nsima ya kokenda kabine to soki maboko ezali na vindo; liboso ya kolia bilei; mpe nsima ya kopopola zolo, kokosola, mpe kosala itche.
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people wash their hands several times with soap and water for twenty seconds, after going to the toilet or if their hands are wet; before eating a meal; and after blowing nose, sneezing, and itching.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: Oyo ezali mpo ete libanda ya nzoto ya moto, virisi ekoki kobamama na sabuni ya ndako, oyo ekotobola ndako na yango ya kobatama.
en-mt: This is because outside the human body, the virus can be transmitted with household soap, which will destroy its breeding ground.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: CDC apesi lisusu toil ete kosokola maboko na kisi oyo ezali na 60% ya lotoko koleka mayi na sabuni ezali mingi te.
en-mt: The CDC also recommends that hand washing with a 60% mild solution is less common than soap and water.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: OMS apesi bato toil batika kosimba miso, zolo to monoko na maboko oyo esokwami te.
en-mt: WHO advises people to stop touching their eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: Bisika ekoki kozala na maladi mpe na basolutionimingi (na minute moko ya komipesa na kozwa malady na koboma microbe na libende), mpe 62-71% ya ethanol, 50-100% ya isopropanol, 0.1% ya sodium hypochloride, 0.5% ya hygrogen peroxide, mpe na 0.2%-7.5% ya povidone-iodine.
en-mt: Surfaces can be disinfected and many solutions (per minute of committing to disinfection with iron disinfection), and 62-71% ethanol, 50-100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hygrogen peroxide , and 0.2%-7.5% povidone-iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: Basolution misusu, lekola benzalkonium chloride na chroxedine gluconate, ezali makasi mingi te.
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chroxedine gluconate, are less potent.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: CDC epesi toil ete soki moto na COVID amonani na lepital to bakanisi akoki kozala na COVID, lokola mpe na mosala, kelasi ya bana, bisika nyonso lekola douche, esika ya kofanda, ba electronic ya kokabola, ba ecran, ba clavier, ba command ya tele, mpe ba machine ATM oyo moto ya kobela asimbi, esengeli kopetola yango.
en-mt: The CDC advises that if a person with COVID is diagnosed in the hospital or suspected of having COVID, as well as at work, kindergarten, anywhere such as shower, living area, shared electronics, screens, keyboards, controls of television, and ATM machines touched by the patient should be cleaned.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: Ba organization ya kolongono esengi bato bakanga monoko mpe zolo na kati ya couode ya liboko to na elamba mpona kokosola to kosala itche, mpe kobwaka yango noki.
en-mt: Health organizations recommend that people cover their mouth and nose with the elbow of the hand or a cloth to avoid coughing or itching, and dispose of it immediately.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: Bamask ya lepital esengeli mpona ba oyo bazali na maladi, mpo ete kolata mask ekoki kosukisa nzela ya matangi ntango moto azali koloba, kosala itche to kokosola.
en-mt: Hospital masks are necessary for those who are sick, as wearing a mask can interrupt the flow of tears when speaking, itching or sneezing.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: OMS epesi mibeko mpona ntango nini kolata bamask.
en-mt: WHO has given guidelines for when to wear masks.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: Stephen Griffin, moyekoli ya bavirisi na universite ya Leeds, alobi ‘’kolata mask ekoki kopekisa bato na kosimba simba elongi, mpo yango ezali ntina ebele ya nzela oyo maladi ezali kokota. ‘’Bamask mpe ekoki kolatama mpona moto oyo azali kosalisa moto oyo koki kozala na malady.
en-mt: Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, said ''wearing a mask can prevent people from touching their faces, because that's the main reason the disease is spreading. ''Masks can also be worn for someone who is caring for someone who may be sick.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: OMS elobi bato oyo bazali kobela te esengeli balata mask kaka soki bazali na risk ya kozwa maladi, lekola ba oyo bazali kosunga moto oyo azali kobela COVID-19, kasi ba moni mpe ntina mpo ete bato batika kosimba simba elongi na bango.
en-mt: The WHO says people who are not sick should only wear masks if they are at risk of getting sick, such as those caring for someone with COVID-19, but they also see the need for people to stop touching their faces.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: Ba mboka mingi bakomi kosenga bato balata bamask na libanda ya ndako.
en-mt: Many countries are requiring people to wear masks outside the home.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: Na U.S, CDC esengi bato balata bamask oyo esalemi na etendi. Chine esengi bato balata bamask oyo elatamaka kaka mbala moko mpona ba oyo bazali kobela te, ntina mingi soki bazali kopusana pene (1 metre (3ft) to mukie) ya bato misusu.
en-mt: In the US, the CDC recommends that people wear masks made of tea. China requires people to wear disposable masks for those who are not sick, especially if they are getting close (1 meter (3ft) or less) to other people.

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: Hong Kong esengi bato balata bamask ya lepital ntango bazali na babis to na bisika oyo bato ebele bazali.
en-mt: Hong Kong requires people to wear hospital masks when in buses or crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: Bakonzi ya kolongono na Thailand basengi bato balata mask ya etendi na ndako mpe basokola yango mokolo nyonso.
en-mt: Health officials in Thailand have urged people to wear a mask at home and wash it daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: Na Republique ya Tcheque mpe na Slovaki batie mibeko oyo epekisi bato babima libanda soki balati mask oyo ekangi zolo na monoko te.
en-mt: The Czech Republic and Slovakia have imposed laws banning people from going outside without wearing a mask covering their nose and mouth.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 16 sanza ya misato, Vietnam asengaki bato nyonso balata bamask ntango bazali kobima libanda mpona komibatelama mpe kobatela baninga.
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam asked everyone to wear masks when going outside to protect themselves and others.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: Gouvernema ya Australie asengaki ete moto nyonso oyo azali kokota zando esengeli alata mask ya elongi.
en-mt: The Australian government has required everyone entering the market to wear a face mask.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: Israel esengaki bato balata mask soki bazali libanda ya ndako.
en-mt: Israel requires people to wear masks when outside the home.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: Taiwan, oyo ezali kosala bamilio zomi ya bamask na mokolo uta katikati ya sanza ya misato, basengaki bato nyonso na train mpe na ba bus balata bamask banda mokolo ya 1 sanza ya minei.
en-mt: Taiwan, which has been producing tens of millions of masks a day since mid-March, has required everyone on trains and buses to wear masks since April

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: Panama esalisi yango mobeko oyo esengeli moto nyono alanda soki bazali kobima libanda ya ndako, mpe bapesi mpe toil kosala bamask ya etendi na ndako mpona ba oyo bakoki kosomba mask te.
en-mt: Panama has made it a requirement for everyone to follow when going outside, and has also offered toil to make homemade masks for those who cannot afford them.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: Bamask esalemi mingi na Japan, Core ya Sud mpe Malasie mpe na Singapore.
en-mt: Masks are widely manufactured in Japan, South Core and Malaysia as well as Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: Kofanda mosika na bato (to kozala mosika na bato) ezali kopekisa bamaladi oyo ekoki kopekisa kosukisa kopalangana ya maladi nako sukisa kofanda bomoko ya bato.
en-mt: Isolation (or isolation) prevents diseases that can prevent the spread of disease by ending social isolation.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: Bametod misusu ezali quarantaine; kokanga ba nzela; mpe kokanga ba kelasi, bisika ya mosala, bastade, ba teatre, mpe bisika ya minene ya babutik ebele.
en-mt: Other methods include quarantine; closing the roads; and the closure of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theaters, and many shopping malls.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: Bato bakoki kosalisa kofanda mosika ya bato na kofanda na ndako, kosala nzela te, kotika kokende bisika oyo bato ebele bazali, kosimba bato te, mpe kozala mosika na bato.
en-mt: People can help stay away from people by staying indoors, not making the road, avoiding crowded places, not touching people, and staying away from people.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: Ba gouvernema mingi bazali kokotisa mibela ya kofanda mosika na bato na bisika oyo epanzani makasi na maladi.
en-mt: Many governments are introducing quarantine measures in high-risk areas.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: Gouvernema ya US alobi ete bato bakoki kozala lisanga kaka soki bazali 250 to mukie (Soki COVID-19 emonani te na lingomba na bango) to 50, mpe nsima balobi 10.
en-mt: The US government says people can only be in a group if they are 250 or fewer (If COVID-19 is not detected in their church) or 50, and then they say

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 22 sanza ya misato 2020, Germany ekataki makambo ya kosangana ya bato 2 to mingi. Bato ya mikolo mpe ba oyo bazali kobela na bamaladi misusu lokola diabete, maladi ya motema, maladi ya kopema, tension, mpe kozanga systeme ya immunite ya nzoto ya makasi bakoki kobela makasi CDC alobi esengeli batikala na ndako na bisika oyo kopalangana ya maladi ezali. Suka ya sanza ya misato 2020, OMS mpe bisika misusu ya kolongona bakomi ko benga ‘Kozala mosika’ na ‘kofanda mosika’, mpona koloba ete esengeli zonto na yo ezala mosika kasi esengeli bato basolola na internet to na mosika.
en-mt: On March 22, 2020, Germany cut the number of 2 or more participants. Seniors and those suffering from other illnesses such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, high blood pressure, and lack of a strong immune system can become seriously ill the CDC says they should stay home in areas where there is a spread of disease. By the end of March 2020, the WHO and other health authorities will be calling 'Stay away' and 'stay away', to mean that your body should be away but people should communicate online or remotely.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: Koloba ‘Kozala mosika’ elobi na bato esengeli basolola at ate na bato, bazala kaka bango moko, kasi esengeli bato basolola soki bakoki. Ba gouvernema misusu bakotisi toil ya kosangana nzoto na pandemic oyo.
en-mt: Saying 'Stay away' tells people they should talk at ate with people, just be alone, but people should talk if they can. Some governments have introduced sexual toil in this pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: Ezali na toil ya kosangana nzoto kaka na moto ozali kofanda ndako moko na ye, oyo azali na virisi to basymptomi te.
en-mt: There is toil to have sex only with someone you live in the same house with, who has no virus or symptoms.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: Konfinema na ndako esengami mpona ba oyo bazali na COVID-19 mpe ba oyo bakanisi bazali na yango.
en-mt: Home confinement is required for those with COVID-19 and suspected cases.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: Bisika ya kolongono epesi toil mpona konfinema ya malamu. Bagouvernema mingi batie mibeko to basengi konfinema ya bato nyonso na bisika oyo maladi ezali.
en-mt: Health facilities provide toil for proper confinement. Many governments have imposed laws or required public quarantine in outbreak areas.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: Mibeko ya konfinema ya makasi epesami na ba oyo bakoki kozwa maladi noki.
en-mt: Strict quarantine measures are imposed on those who are susceptible to infection.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: Ba oyo bazalaki pene na moto oyo azali na COVID-19 mpe ba oyo bauti nzela na bisika to bamboka oyo ezali na maladi makasi kofanda na konfinema mpona mikolo 14.
en-mt: Those who have been close to a person with COVID-19 and those who have traveled from seriously ill areas or countries stay in quarantine for 14 days.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: Ndenge ya kobundela kopalangana oyo eza kosukisa to kokitisa to kozongisa yango nsima.
en-mt: How to fight this spread is to stop or reduce or reverse it.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: Kosukisa ezali kosalema na ebandeli ya kopalangana ezali kolanda bato mpe kokonfine ba oyo bazali na maladi mpe kosala misusu oyo ekozongisa maladi nsima mpe kopesa ba vaccine na bato mpona kokitisa malady na population.
en-mt: The end is being done at the beginning of the outbreak is to track people and confine those who are sick and do other things that will reverse the disease and vaccinate people to reduce the disease in the population.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: Ntango ekomi mpasi kokanga kopalangana ya maladi, mosalo siko oyo ekomi ya: kokitisa kopalangana ya virisi na lingomba.
en-mt: As it becomes harder to contain the spread of disease, the task now becomes: reducing the spread of the virus in the church.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: Mosala ya kosukisa na kokitisa ekoki kosalema elongo moko.
en-mt: The task of terminating and reducing can be done simultaneously.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: Kokitisa esengi ete mosala mingi esalema mpona kobalola panama na kokitisa kopanza na yango na moto 1. Kolandela maladi ezali kokitisa kopusana ya nzela ya pandemic, eyo ebengami kokitisa pusa ya pandemic.
en-mt: Reduction requires more work to turn panama around by reducing its spread to 1 person. Disease surveillance is reducing the approach of the pandemic path, which is called pandemic push reduction.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: Oyo ekitisaki risk ya bisika ya kosalisa nzoto etonda mingi mpe epesi ntango mpona vaccine na kisi esalama.
en-mt: This reduced the risk of overcrowding and allowed time for vaccines and drugs to be developed.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: Makambo oyo ezali ya lepital te oyo ekoki kosalisa mpe esali kopesisa maladi eyaka ezali kosokola maboko, kolata bamask, konfinema; mibeko ya ligomba mpona kofanda mosika na bato lekola kokanga ba kelasi mpe kopekisa bato mingi basangana; kondima ya ligomba na kosala makambo oyo; mpe kopetola likola ya biloko na egumba. Mibeko misusu ya makasi ezwamaki na Chine ntango ete likama ekomaki monene, batiaki egumba mobimba na konfinema mpe bakangi ba nzela.
en-mt: Non-hospital measures that can help and cause transmission include hand washing, wearing masks, confinement; church social distancing rules such as closing classes and banning mass gatherings; the faith of the church in doing these things; and cleaning up the city. Some strict measures were taken in China when the disaster escalated, the entire city was placed under quarantine and roads were closed.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: Ba mboka misusu batie mibeko mpona kosukisa virisi.
en-mt: Some countries have imposed laws to eradicate the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: Core ya Sud ebandaki kosale ba ekzame ya minene mpe babongisaki bisika ya konfinema, mpe bapekisi bato batambola mingi.
en-mt: The South Core began conducting extensive tests and improved quarantine facilities, and restricted movement.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: Singapore epesaki mbongo na ba oyo bamitiaki na konfinema mpe batiaki etumbu mpona ba oyo baboyaki kosala yango.
en-mt: Singapore gave money to those who confined themselves and imposed penalties for those who refused to do so.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: Taiwan ematisaki kosala bamask mpe batiaki etumba na ba oyo bazalaki kombomba bamask ebele. Oyo esali Angleterre na Etats Unis elakisi (kopusa nsima kasi kosukisa kopalangana ya pandemi) été kosukisa (kozongisa pandemi nsima) ezali makasi mingi.
en-mt: Taiwan increased mask production and put a war on those who were hiding too many masks. What has happened to England and the United States means (delaying but stopping the spread of the pandemic) that stopping (reversing the pandemic) is very difficult.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: Mibeko ya kosukisa ekoki kosalisa ba oyo bazali kosala na balepital na kokitisa boni ya bato bazali kokende na 2/3 mpe kokata kufa na ndambo mpe mpasi ya ba oyo bazali kosala mosala na lepital.
en-mt: Final legislation can help hospital workers reduce the number of people attending by 2/3 and cut the death and suffering of hospital workers by half.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: Kosukisa ekoki kozala malamu kasi esengeli ekende liboso kaka soki virisi mpe ezali kaka na kati ya bato (to ti mokolo oyo vaccine eko yaka), mpo ete kopalangana ezongaka soki bato bakeyi liboso na mibeko ya kosukisa te.
en-mt: Termination may be effective but should only proceed if the virus is also still in the population (or until the day a vaccine arrives), because the spread will resume if people do not proceed with termination measures.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: Mibeko ya ntango molayi na kosukisa pandemic ekozala talo mpona ligomba mpe nkita.
en-mt: Long-term measures to end the pandemic will be costly for society and the economy.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: Kisi ya kobikisa nani ezali te mpona CODI-19, kasi mosala ya kosalela yango ezali, mpe na komeka bakisi oyo ezali.
en-mt: There is no cure for CODI-19, but there is work to be done, and in testing available drugs.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: Komela kisi ya kosukosu oyo osombi na pharmacy, komela ba mayi, mpe kolala malamu ekoki kosalisa na ba symptom.
en-mt: Taking over-the-counter cough medicine, drinking fluids, and getting enough sleep can help with symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: Soki ezali makasi koleka, thepari ya oxygen, kolekisa biloko na kati ya mongongo, mpe bamachine ya kopema ekoki kosalisa.
en-mt: If it is more severe, thepari of oxygen, passage of substances into the voice, and breathing machines may help.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: Kosalisa ba steroids ekoki kotumbola makambo na ndenge ya mabe.
en-mt: Steroid treatment can make things worse.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: Basymptomi mingi endimamaki kosalisama na bakisi y aba maladi ya ba virisi misusu ezali na etid mpona kosalisama mpona COVID-19.
en-mt: Many symptoms approved for treatment with antiviral drugs are etid to treat for COVID-1

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: OMS mpe alobaki ‘’bakisi misusu ya mboka mpe ya ndako’’ ekoki kosalisa basymptomi oyo ya SARS-CoV-19.
en-mt: The WHO also said ''other local and home remedies'' can treat these SARS-CoV-19 symptoms.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: Komatisa mpe kobungisa balepital mpona mposa y aba oyo bazali kobela na COVID-19 ezali ntina makasi na etumba oyo elobi OMS.
en-mt: Increasing and losing hospitals for the needs of COVID-19 patients is a key factor in the fight, according to the WHO.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: ECDC na biro ya Europe ya OMS babimisi mibeko mpona balepital ba banganga mpona kosalisa biloko na bisika misusu ya kolongono, lekola kosalisa laboratoir na baekzame ya COVID-19, kopekisa ba mposa misusu ya bato ya kobela, kotia mosika to na konfinema ba oyo bazali na COVID-19, mpe komatisa ndenge ya kosalisa bato na kotangisa bato ya lepial mpe kozala na bamachine ya pema mingi na ba mbeto.
en-mt: The ECDC and the WHO European office have issued guidelines for medical hospitals to provide services to other health facilities, such as providing laboratory tests for COVID-19, restricting certain needs of patients, isolating or confining those with COVID-19, and increase treatment by lepial education and more ventilators in beds.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: Maloba ezali mingi na esika oyo moto ya maladi oyo ya liboso (oyo babengi patient zero) euti.
en-mt: There is a lot of talk about where this first patient (called patient zero) comes from.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: Moto ya kobela ya liboso na coronavirisi ya sika akoki kouta mokolo ya 1 sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019 na Wuhan, Hubei, Chine.
en-mt: The first case of the new coronavirus may come from December 1, 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: Na sanza moko, bato oyo bazalaki na maladi ya coronavirisi na Hubei emataki makasi.
en-mt: In a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei rose sharply.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Bazalaki bato oyo bazalaki na banzela ya zando ya Huanan, oyo ezalaki koteka banyama ya bomoi pe, mpe maloba moko elobi ete virisi yango euti na banyama oyo; to; oyo misusu balobi ewuti na banyama ya zamba to ezali zoonotic. Bato mingi bazalaki kobela pneumona na mokolo ya 26 sanza ya zomi mpe basilisaki bango na monganga Zhang Jixian na Lepital ya egumba ya Hubei, ayebisaki CDC ya Jianghan na Wuhan na mokolo ya 27 sanza ya zomi.
en-mt: They were people on the streets of the Huanan market, which sold live animals as well, and one rumor has it that the virus came from these animals; either; some of which have been reported to originate from wild animals or are zoonotic. Several people were suffering from pneumonia on Oct. 26 and were treated by Dr. Zhang Jixian at Hubei City Hospital, told the Jianghan CDC in Wuhan on Oct. 27.

sourceString: On 30 December, a group of doctors at Wuhan Central Hospital alerted their colleagues of a "SARS-like coronavirus".
targetString: Na mokolo ya 30 sanza ya zomi mibale, lisanga ya banganga na Lepital ya Egumba ya Wuhan bayebisaki baninga ete maladi moko ya ‘’SARS-lekola-coronavirisi’’ ezalaki kotambola.
en-mt: On December 30, a group of doctors at Wuhan City Hospital told friends that a ''SARS-like-coronavirus'' outbreak was circulating.

sourceString: Eight of these doctors, including Li Wenliang, were admonished by the police for spreading false rumours, and another, Ai Fen, was reprimanded by her superiors for raising the alarm.
targetString: Mwambe ya banganga, mpe Li Wenliang, basimbaki bango na police mpo ete balobaki makambo ya lekuta, Ai Fen, bakataki ye mosala na bakonzi na ye mpo ete abimisaki likama yango.
en-mt: Eight priests, including Li Wenliang, were detained by the police for making false statements, Ai Fen, was suspended by his superiors for revealing the accident.

sourceString: The Wuhan Municipal Health Commission later released a public notice on 31 December and informed the WHO.
targetString: Commission ya kolongono ya egumba ya Wuhan babimisaki sango mokolo ya 31 sanza ya zomi mpe bayebisaki OMS.
en-mt: The Wuhan City Health Commission issued a statement on October 31 and informed the WHO.

sourceString: Enough cases of unknown pneumonia had been reported to health authorities in Wuhan to trigger an investigation in early January.During the early stages of the outbreak, the number of cases doubled approximately every seven and a half days.
targetString: Bato mingi oyo bazalaki kobela pneumona bafundaki bango na basali ya kolongono na Wuhan mpo ete basosola yango na ebandeli ya sanza ya liboso. Mikolo ya liboso ya kopalangana ya maladi, limero ya bato oyo bazalaki kobela ezalaki komata makasi na mikolo nsambo to na ndambo ya mokolo.
en-mt: Many people with pneumonia were reported to health workers in Wuhan for diagnosis early in the first month. In the early days of the outbreak, the number of cases rose sharply in seven or half days.

sourceString: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus spread to other Chinese provinces, helped by the Chinese New Year migration and Wuhan being a transport hub and major rail interchange.
targetString: Na ebandeli mpe na katikati na sanza ya liboso na 2020, virisi ekotaki ba egumba misusu na Chines, esungamaki na feti ya ebandeli ya mbula mpe mpo ete Wuhan ezali esika ya nzela oyo batrai ezali kosuka ebele.
en-mt: In early and mid-January 2020, the virus entered other cities in China, helped by the New Year's Eve holiday and because Wuhan is a traffic stop.

sourceString: On 20 January, China reported nearly 140 new cases in one day, including two people in Beijing and one in Shenzhen.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 20 sanza ya liboso, Chine elobaki ete bazalaki na bato ya kobela 140 na mokolo moko, mpe bato mibale na Beinjing na moko na Shenzhen.
en-mt: On January 20, China reported 140 cases in one day, with two cases in Beinjing and one in Shenzhen.

sourceString: Later official data shows that 6,174 people had already developed symptoms by 20 January 2020.As of 26 March, the United States has overtaken China and Italy with the highest number of confirmed cases in the world.As of 9 April 2020, more than 1.61 million cases have been reported worldwide; more than 97,000 people have died and more than 364,000 have recovered.
targetString: Nsima balimero ya gouvernema elakisi 6,174 ya bato oyo bazalaki na basymptomi na mokolo ya 20 sanza ya liboso 2020. Na mokolo ya 26 ya sanza ya misato, Etats Unis eleki Chine na Italie na bato mingi koleka oyo bazali na maladi na mokili. Na mokolo ya 9 sanza ya minei 2020, koleka bato 1.61 milio bazalaki kobela na mokili; koleka 97,000 bakufaki mpe koleka 364,000 babikaki.
en-mt: Then government figures show 6,174 people with symptoms as of January 20, 2020. As of March 26, the United States has surpassed China and Italy with the highest number of cases in the world. As of April 9, 2020, more than 1.61 million people were sick worldwide; more than 97,000 died and more than 364,000 survived.

sourceString: Around 200 countries and territories have had at least one case.
targetString: Bamboka 200 mpe bisika nazalaki na mwa moto moko ya kobela.
en-mt: 200 towns and places I had some one sick person.

sourceString: Due to the pandemic in Europe, many countries in the Schengen Area have restricted free movement and set up border controls.
targetString: Likolo ya pandemic na Europe, ba mboka mingi na Schengen bapekisa bato batambola mingi mpe bakangaki ba nzela.
en-mt: Because of the pandemic in Europe, many Schengen countries have banned travel and closed roads.

sourceString: National reactions have included containment measures such as quarantines (known as stay-at-home orders, shelter-in-place orders, or lockdown) and curfews.As of 2 April, nearly 300 million people, or about 90% of the population, are under some form of lockdown in the United States, more than 50 million people are in lockdown in the Philippines, about 59 million people are in lockdown in South Africa, and 1.3 billion people are in lockdown in India.
targetString: Bato batiami na konfinema na mokili (mibeko ya ebengami kofanda na ndako, kitala na ndako, to konfinema) mpe kotia ban tango ya kobima libanda. Na mokolo ya 2 sanza ya minei, bato 300 milio to 90% ya population, bazali na konfinema ya ndenge moko na Etats Unis, koleka 50 milio bato bazali na konfinema na Philippines, koleka 59 milio bazali na konfinema na Afrik di sid, mpe 1.3 bilio na konfinema na Inde.
en-mt: People are placed under ground confinement (so-called stay at home, home quarantine, or confinement rules) and set bans on going outside. As of April 2, 300 million people or 90% of the population, are under similar quarantine in the United States, more than 50 million people are under quarantine in the Philippines, more than 59 million are under quarantine in South Africa, and bilio and confined to India.

sourceString: On 26 March, 1.7 billion people worldwide were under some form of lockdown, which increased to 2.6 billion people two days later—around a third of the world's population.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 26 sanza ya misato, 1.7 bilio ya baton a mokili bazalaki na konfinema, oyo etindaki bato 2.6 bilio na mokili mikolo kaka mibale oyo elekaki bakota konfinema – mwa nyonso ya population ya mokili mobimba.
en-mt: As of March 26, 1.7 billion people in the world were under quarantine, which prompted 2.6 billion people in the world just two days ago to go into quarantine – almost all of the world’s population.

sourceString: The first confirmed case of COVID-19 has been traced back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan; one unconfirmed report suggests the earliest case was on 17 November.
targetString: Moto ya liboso yo abelaki COVID-19 bamoni ete ezalaki na mokoli ya 1 na sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019 na Wuhan, misusu balobi ete ekoki kozala mokolo ya 17 sanza ya zomi na moko.
en-mt: The first case of COVID-19 was confirmed in December 2019 in Wuhan, some suggest it could be November

sourceString: Doctor Zhang Jixian observed a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 26 December, upon which her hospital informed Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: Monganga Zhang Jixian amonaki bato ya kobela ya pneumonia mingi na mokolo ya 26 sanza ya zomi na mibale, mpe nsima lepital na ye eyebisaki CDC ya Jianghan na Wuhan na mokolo ya 27 sanza ya zomi na mibale.
en-mt: Dr. Zhang Jixian saw several cases of pneumonia on December 26, and then his hospital notified the Jianghan CDC in Wuhan on December 27.

sourceString: Initial genetic testing of patient samples on 27 December 2019 indicated the presence of a SARS-like coronavirus.
targetString: Baekzame ya liboso oyo emonaki genetic y aba oyo bazalaki kobela na mokolo ya 27 sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019 emonaki SARS-lekola ya- coronavirisi.
en-mt: The first genetic tests of the sick y aba on December 27, 2019 revealed SARS-like of- coronavirus.

sourceString: A public notice was released by Wuhan Municipal Health Commission on 31 December.
targetString: Commission ya Kolongono na Egumba ya Wuhan epesaki sango na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya zomi na moko.
en-mt: The Wuhan City Health Commission reported on November

sourceString: The WHO was informed on the same day.
targetString: OMS mpe epesaki sango mokolo wana.
en-mt: The WHO also provided information that day.

sourceString: As these notifications occurred, doctors in Wuhan were warned by police for "spreading rumours" about the outbreak.
targetString: Ntango basango oyo ezalaki kosalema, banganga na Wuhan bapekisaki bango na police balboa lokuta te na likama wana.
en-mt: While this news was being made, priests in Wuhan were prevented by police from balboa not lying about the accident.

sourceString: The Chinese National Health Commission initially claimed that there was no "clear evidence" of human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Commission ya mboka mpona kolongono na Chine elobaki ete malady yando ezali kotambola kati na bato te ‘’eloko te elakisi yango’’.
en-mt: China's National Health Commission said yando is not circulating among people ''nothing indicates it'

sourceString: In late January, the Chinese government launched a radical campaign later described by the Chinese Communist Party general secretary Xi Jinping as a "people's war" to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Na suka ya sanza ya liboso, gouvernema ya Chine abandaki compagne oyo babengaki na secretaire general ya politik ya bacommunist Xi Jinping ete bazali na ‘’etumba’’ ya kolanda kopalangana ya virisi.
en-mt: In late January, the Chinese government launched a campaign called by Communist Political Secretary-General Xi Jinping that they were in a ''war'' to keep up with the spread of the virus.

sourceString: In what has been described as "the largest quarantine in human history", a cordon sanitaire was announced on 23 January stopping travel in and out of Wuhan, which was extended to a total of 15 cities in Hubei, affecting a total of about 57 million people.
targetString: Oyo babengi ezali lekola ‘’konfinema ya monene na masolo ya mokili’’, mosala ya kolongono ebandaki mokolo ya 23 na sanza ya liboso kopekisa banzela ya kokota mpe kobima Wuhan, oyo esalemaki na ba egumba 15 na Hubei, mpona bato 57 milio.
en-mt: Described as the ''largest lockdown in world history'', the health operation began on January 23 closing entry and exit routes to Wuhan, which was imposed in 15 cities in Hubei, for 57 million people.

sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: Mituka ya bato epekisamaki na egumba.
en-mt: Private cars were banned in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: Feti ya ebandeli ya sanza na Chine (25 sanza ya liboso) esukisamaki.
en-mt: The celebration of the beginning of the moon in China (25th of the first month) was concluded.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: Bakonzi mpe babandaki kotonga lepital ya huoshenshan oyo basilisaki na mikolo 10.
en-mt: The authorities also began the construction of the huoshenshan hospital which was completed in 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: Lepital mosusu esalemaki nsima, lepital ya leishenshan, mpona kosalisa bato ya kobela.
en-mt: Another hospital was later established, the Leishenshan Hospital, to treat the sick.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: Lisusu mpe na balepital ya sika, Chine ebongisaki mpe bisika 14 na Wuhan, lekola ba stade na bisika ya lisanga ya mineinei, na balepital. Na mokolo ya 26 sanza ya liboso, gouvernema ebandaki kolandela kopalangana ya COVID-19, mpe kopesa toil na ba oyo bazalaki kosala nzela na feti ya Spring.
en-mt: In addition to the new hospitals, China has also renovated 14 facilities in Wuhan, such as stadiums and four-story community centers, with hospitals. On January 26, the government began monitoring the spread of COVID-19, and issuing toil to those making their way to the Spring Festival.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: Ba universite na bakelasi na mboka ekangaki.
en-mt: Universities and schools in the country closed.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: Ba egumba na Hong Kong bakotisaki mibeko mingi, mpona oyo etali ba kelasi na ba universite.
en-mt: The cities in Hong Kong have introduced many laws, regarding classes and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: Kasala mosala na mosika ebandaki na ba egumba na Chine.
en-mt: Remote work started in cities in China.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: Bakotisaki mibeko ya kokanga banzela na Hubei.
en-mt: Road closures were introduced in Hubei.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: Babis ekomaki ndenge mosusu, mpe na bamuse na kati ya Chine ekangaki.
en-mt: Babis became different, and with muses within China it caught on.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: Kolandela kotambola ya bato esalemaki na ba egumba ebele, mpe elobami ete bato 760 milio (eleki ndambo ya population) bapekisamaki kobima libanda. Nsima oyo malady ekotaki na sanza ya misato, gouvernema ya Chine ekotisaki mibeko ya makasi mpona kopekisa virisi ekota ba mboka misusu.
en-mt: Traffic monitoring was carried out in several cities, and it is estimated that 760 million people (more than half the population) were banned from going outside. After the outbreak in March, the Chinese government introduced strict measures to prevent the virus from spreading to other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: Lekola, na Beijing batiaki mibeko ya konfinema ya mikolo 14 mpona bato nyonso oyo bauti ba mboka misusu. Na mokolo ya 23 sanza ya misato, Chine ezalaki kaka na moto moko oyo azwaki maladi na kati ya mboka na mikolo mitano, eutaki na moto moko oyo autaki Guangzhou azalaki kozonga na Istanbul.
en-mt: Yesterday, Beijing imposed a 14-day quarantine for all foreign arrivals. As of March 23, China had only one domestic case in five days, from a person returning to Istanbul from Guangzhou.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 24 sanza ya misato 2020, moto ya liboso ya Chine Li Keqiang alobaki ete kopalangana ya maladi na ba oyo bazali kati na mboka esimbamaki mpe Chine alandaki likama yango malamu.
en-mt: On March 24, 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said the spread of the disease among those in the country had been contained and China was closely monitoring the threat.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: Mokolo wana kaka bakangaki banzela na Hubei, batikaki Wuhan, ba sanza mibale nsima ya konfinema. Ministre ya bapaya ya Chine na Hubei alobaki mokolo ya 26 sanza ya misato 2020 ete bakoki kopesa ba visa ten a mikanda ya kokota mboka mikolo oyo te banda mokolo ya 28 sanza ya misato mpe emati, bayebisaki te mobeko oyo ekosila mokolo nini.
en-mt: The same day they closed roads in Hubei, they left Wuhan, two months after the lockdown. China's Foreign Minister in Hubei said on March 26, 2020 that visas ten a entry permits can not be issued today since March 28 and increased, they did not say when the rule will expire.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: Ba oyo balingi kokota Chine bakosenga visa na Ambassade ya Chine to na Consulaire.
en-mt: Those wishing to enter China will apply for a visa at the Chinese Embassy or Consulate.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: Gouvernema ya Chine epesaki toil na ba companie bafondolo mokolo ya 30 sanza ya misato, mpe bapesaki mbongo mukie na ba oyo bazali na ba companie. Bakonzi ya egumba basengaki ete mokolo ya kolela ezala na 10:00 mokolo 4 sanza ya minei, ekutamaki na feti ya Qingming, kasi gouvernema ya monene esengaki bato bakanisa bato na internet mpona kotosa kozala mosika na bato mpona pandemic ya COVID-19.
en-mt: The Chinese government gave toil to the companies closed on March 30, and gave small amounts of money to the owners of the companies. City officials called for a day of mourning at 10:00 am on April 4, coinciding with the Qingming festival, but the central government urged people to remember people online to observe social distancing due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: COVID-19 epanzanaki na Core ya Sud na mokolo ya 20 sanza ya liboso 2020 na Chine.
en-mt: COVID-19 spread to South Korea on January 20, 2020 in China.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: Esika ya egumba ya kolongono balobaki ete bato ya kobela bazali komata mokolo ya 20 sanza ya minei, ezalaki mpona lisanga oyo esalemaki na losambo ya Daegu oyo babengi Eklesia ya Yesu ya Shincheonji.
en-mt: The city's health center said the increase in cases on April 20 was due to a Daegu religious group called the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: Bato ya Shincheonji oyo bakendaki Daegu na Wuhan bamonaki ete bango moto bapanzaki malady.
en-mt: Shincheonji people who went to Daegu and Wuhan were found to have spread the disease.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 22 sanza ya mibale, bato 9,336 ya Eklesia, 1,261 to 13% bazalaki na basymptomi. Core ya Sud ezalaki na mingi ya bato ya kobela ya mokolo ya 23 sanza ya mibale 2020.
en-mt: On February 22, 9,336 members of the Church, 1,261 or 13% were symptomatic. The South Core had the majority of the February 23, 2020 cases.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 28 sanza ya mibale, koleka bato 2,000 bazalaki na maladi na Kore, emataki na 3,150 na mokolo ya 29 sanza ya mibale.
en-mt: On February 28th, more than 2,000 people were sick in Korea, rising to 3,150 on February 29th.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: Bisika nyonso ya bato ya limpimgo ya Core ya Sud batiaki bango na konfinema nsima ya kosala bango ekzame bamonaki ete bato ya limpimgo misato bazalaki na virisi.
en-mt: All South Korean prisoners were quarantined after three prisoners tested positive for the virus.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: Ba ngona ya mpepo mpe emonaki mpasi. Core ya Sud ebandaki mosala oyo ya liboso mpe ya monene na moili mpona kosala ekzame ya population ya virisi, mpe kokonfine ba oyo bazalaki na yango mpe kolande ba oyo bazalaki pene na bango.
en-mt: Flight hours also suffered. The South Core began this first and largest operation in the dark to test the virus population, and confine those who had it and track those close to them.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: Mosala ya kosala ekzame esengelaki bato bango moko bayaka liboso soki bazali na basymptomi mpona ba oyo bauti mboka ya mopaya bakoki koyebisa na application ya telephone,ba nzela ya public ya mituka mpe ezalaki kosala ekzame ya virisi mpe ematisaki mosala ya kosala ekzame na 20,000 ya bato oyo basalelami ekzame na mokolo moko.
en-mt: The testing required people to come forward if they had symptoms so those from abroad could report the phone application, public roads and was testing for the virus and increased the testing to 20,000 people used examination in a day.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: Emonanaki ete rogram ya Core ya Sud ezalaki kolandela maladi malamu soki ata batiaki ba egumba na konfinema te. Societe ya Core ya Sud babebisamaki na mokambi Jae-in na oyo ye alobaki likolo ya likama oyo.
en-mt: It turned out that the South Korean rogram was monitoring the disease well even if the cities were not quarantined. South Korean society were destroyed by President Jae-in on what he said about this disaster.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: Ba Coreen mingi batiaki elembo mpo ete ye alongola na mosala mpona oyo bango babengaki kosimba maladi malamu te, to kosepela na nini ye alobaki.
en-mt: Many Coreen signed for him to be fired for what they called poor handling of the disease, or not liking what he said.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 23 sanza ya misato, balobaki Core ya Sud ezalaki na kobelo ya mukie na ba mposo minei mpo ezalaki kaka moto moko.
en-mt: On March 23, the South Core was reported to have had a small bell in four weeks because there was only one person.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 29 sanza ya misato elobamaki ete banda mokolo ya 1 bato nyonso oyo bauti mboka ya mopaya bakokota konfinema mpona ba mposo minei.
en-mt: On March 29 it was announced that from 1st all immigrants would be quarantined for four weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: Na ndenge basango elobi na mokolo ya 1 sanza ya minei, Bato basengaki Core ya Sud biloko ya ekzame na bamboka 121.
en-mt: As per reports on April 1, People have requested South Core for examination materials in 121 villages.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: Iran emonaki bato na maladi ya SRS-CoV-2 na mokolo ya 19 sanza ya mibale na Qom, esika oyo mpona ministere ya kolongono mpe ya kotanga kolongono, bato mibale bakufaki mokolo yango.
en-mt: Iran reported a case of SRS-CoV-2 on February 19 in Qom, where according to the Ministry of Health and Nursing, two people died that day.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: Gouvernema abandaki mosala ya noki na kokanga ba concerts, masano, losambo ya mokolo ya mitani, mpe kokanga ba universite be bisika misusu ya kotanga na bakelasi.
en-mt: The government began swift action by closing concerts, games, Friday worship, and closing universities be other places of learning to classes.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: Iran ebimisaki mbongo trilio misato mpona kobundela virisi.
en-mt: Iran spent three trillion dollars to fight the virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: Mokamdi Hassan Rouhani alobaki mokolo ya 26 sanza ya mibale 2020 ete bango balingaki te kotia baton a konfinema na bisika oyo baton a malady bazalaki, kaka bango moto bakokota konfinema.
en-mt: President Hassan Rouhani said on February 26, 2020 that they did not want to put people in quarantine in places where people were sick, only they would enter the quarantine.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: Mosala ya kosukisa banzela na kati ya egumba ebandaki na sanza ya misato, kasi embouteyage monene na babalabala ezalaki liboso ya feti ya ebandeli ya sanza ya Ersian Nowruz.
en-mt: Work on completing roads in the city began in March, but the major traffic jam on the streets was ahead of the early holiday of the month of Ersian Nowruz.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: Bisika ya losambo na Shia ekangaki ten a pilgrims ti mokolo ya 16 sanza ya misato 2020. Iran akomaki mboka oyo ezalaki na malady makasi koleka nsima ya Chine na sanza ya mibale.
en-mt: Shia places of worship have closed ten a pilgrims until March 16, 2020. Iran became the second most affected country after China in February.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: Ata oyo balobaki ete bango bazalaki kobomba basekele ya palangana na Iran, bamboka zomi eleki balobaki moto na bango ya liboso ya kobela autaki Iran na mokolo ya 28 sanza ya mibale, koloba ete maladi ezali makasi ya koleka bato ya kobela 388 oyo gouvernema ya Iran elobi.
en-mt: Despite claiming to be keeping secrets of the spread in Iran, the past ten countries reported their first case from Iran on February 28, saying the disease is more severe than the Iranian government's 388 cases . . . .

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: Parlement ya Iran ekangaki, mpo ete 23 ya 290 ya baton a bango bamonanaki na virisi mokolo ya 3 sansa ya misato.
en-mt: Iran's parliament closed, after 23 of its 290 members tested positive for the virus on Wednesday.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 12 sanza ya misato, bato ya Kososola Bonsoni ya Bato basengaki bakonzi ya boloko ya Iran babimisa bato oyo bazalaki kobundela bonsoni ya bato mpe kobimisa mpona tango mokuse bato misusu oyo bazalaki na boloko.
en-mt: On March 12, Human Rights Watch called on Iranian prison authorities to release human rights activists and temporarily release other prisoners.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: Elobaki ete risk ya virisi ezali makasi na kopalangana na kati ya boloko, oyo bazali na balepital ya malamu te.
en-mt: It said the risk of the virus is high in spreading within prisons, which do not have adequate hospitals.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 15 sanza ya misato, gouvernema ya Iran ekomaki na bato 100 oyo bakufaki na mokolo moko, ya mingi koleka na mboka uta pandemic ebandaki.
en-mt: On March 15, the Iranian government recorded 100 deaths in a single day, the highest in the country since the pandemic began.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: 12 ya bato ya politik na gouvernema ya Iran bakufaki na maladi yango na mokolo ya 17 sanza ya misato.
en-mt: 12 politicians in the Iranian government died of the disease on 17 March.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 23 sanza ya misato, Iran ezalaki na bato ya kobela 50 na ngonga moko mpe moko azalaki kokufa na baminute 10 na coronavirisi.
en-mt: As of March 23, Iran had 50 cases per hour and one death every 10 minutes from the virus.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: Mpona bato ya OMS, bato ya Iran ekoki kozala mitano koleka na oyo balobi.
en-mt: For WHO officials, Iranians may be five more than they say.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: Elobami mpe ete mibeko oyo Etats Unis atie Iran etungisi nkita na bango na kobundela virisi ya pandame.
en-mt: It is also said that US sanctions against Iran have affected their economy in the fight against the pandemic virus.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: Commisariat ya Likolo ya ONU mpona Bonsoni ya bato esengi ete mibeko oyo ezali kotungisa nkita ya bamboka esukisama mpona pandemi, lokola oyo ya Iran.
en-mt: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has called for an end to laws that are affecting the economy of countries because of the pandemic, such as that in Iran.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: Pandemi epanzamaki na Italy na mokolo ya 31 sanza ya liboso, ntango bachinois mibale bamonanaki na SARS-CoV-2 na Rome.
en-mt: The pandemic broke out in Italy on January 31, when two Chinese were diagnosed with SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: Bato ya kobela ebandaki komata noki makasi esengaki gouvernema ya Italie ekanga nzela ya ba mpepo oyo ezali kouta Chine mpe abenga likambo yango likama.
en-mt: The rapid rise in cases prompted the Italian government to suspend flights from China and call the situation a disaster.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: Lisanga ya bato mingi oyo bazalaki na COVID-19 emonanaki, ebandaki na bato 16 na lombardy na mokolo ya 21 sanza ya mibale, na mokolo ya 22 sanza ya mibale, Lisanga ya Toli ya baministre elobaki ete mibeko ya sika ezali mpona kolandela pandemi, lekola konfinema ya bato 50,000 koleka na ba egumba 11 na Nord ya Italie.
en-mt: The highest number of cases of COVID-19 was detected, starting with 16 people in lombardy on 21 February, on 22 February, the Council of Ministers said that new measures are in place to monitor the pandemic, lekola confinement of more than 50,000 people in 11 cities in Northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: Ministre ya liboso Giuseppe Conte alobaki, ‘’Na bisika oyo pandemic ebeti makasi, kokota na kobima eko zala te.
en-mt: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, ''In areas hit hard by the pandemic, there will be no entry and exit.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: Kosukisa ya mosala mpe na masano ebandi na bisika wana misusu. ‘’Na mokolo ya 4 sanza ya misato, gouvernema ya Italie asengaki bakanga ba kelasi na ba universite nyonso na mboka ntango oyo Italie akomaki na bato 100 oyo bakufaki na maladi.
en-mt: The end of work and play begins in those other places. ''On March 4, the Italian government ordered the closure of classes at all universities in the country when Italy reached 100 deaths from the disease.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: Masano nyonso ya minene, mpe Footbal ya serie A, elingaki ezalema na kati ya esika bakangi baporte na sanza ya minei, kasi na mokolo ya 9 sanza ya misato, masano nyonso ekatanaki mpona sanza moko kokende liboso.
en-mt: All major games, including Series A Football, were supposed to be held behind closed doors in April, but on March 9, all games were suspended for a month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: Na sanza ya misato mokolo ya 11, minister ya liboso Conte atindaki ba business nyonso oyo bazali koteka biloko bakanga batika kaka bazando na bapharmacy. Na mokolo ya 6 sanza ya misato, Colle ya Italie ya Anaesthesie, Analgesie, Resuscitation mpe Kolsalisa makasi (SIAARTI) ebimisi etid ya sante mpona ndenge nini kokabola biliko.
en-mt: On March 11, Prime Minister Conte ordered all businesses selling goods to close and leave only markets and pharmacies. On March 6, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) issued a health etid on how to distribute the gifts.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: Na mokolo y a19 sanza ya misato, Italy elekaki Chines na bato oyo bakufaki na coronavirisi mpe mokili nyonso ekomaki na bato ya kokufa 3,405 na pandemic.
en-mt: On March 19, Italy surpassed China in the number of deaths from the coronavirus and the worldwide death toll from the pandemic reached 3,4

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 22 sanza ya misato, elobamaki ete Russie etindaki bam pepo libwa na biloko ya lepital na Italie.
en-mt: On March 22, Russia reportedly sent nine planes with hospital supplies to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 5 sanza ya minei, bato ya kobela bazalaki 128,948, 15,887 bakufaki, mpe 21,815 babikaki na Italy, mingi na bango bazalaki na Lombardy.
en-mt: As of April 5, there were 128,948 cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 survivors in Italy, mostly in Lombardy.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: Rapor ya CNN elobaki ete bato ya mikolo na Italy oyo bakokaki kozwa ekzame te moto esali ete bazala na kufa mingi.
en-mt: A CNN report said that older people in Italy who could not get tested have a higher mortality rate.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: Mosala ya Angletere ya liboso mpona kobundela virisi ebandaki malembe na bamboka oyo esimbaki, mpe na mokolo ya 18 sanza ya misato 2020, gouvernema ya Angleterre akotisaki mibeko ata moko te mpona kozala mosika na bato to konfinema na bato ya mboka.
en-mt: The UK’s initial efforts to fight the virus have been slow in the affected countries, and as of 18 March 2020, the UK government has not introduced any social distancing or confinement measures.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: Mpe bongo, bato basepelaki ten a gouvvernema mpo ete basalaki mingi te mpona likama oyo ezali kati na bato. Na mokolo ya 16 sanza ya misato, minister ya liboso Boris Johnson alobaki ete bato batika kobima libanda ya mboka soki ezali ntina makasi te mpe bazala mosika na bato mpe bakenda te bisika lekola babar, malewa, mpe bateatre.
en-mt: And so, people were happy ten a gouvvernema because they didn’t do much about the danger among the people. On March 16, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said people should stop leaving the country unless absolutely necessary and stay away from people and not go to places like bars, pubs, and theatres.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 20 sanza ya misato, gouvrnema alobaki ete bisika nyonso ya kosepelisa nzoto lokola bagyms esengelaki bakanga, mpe bako futa baton a bango ya mosala 80% ya salaire na bango to £2,500 na sanza mpo ete bato batika kozanga mosala. Na mokolo ya 23 saza ya misato, minister ya liboso akotisaki mibeko ya makasi mpona kozala mosika na bato, akataki lisanga nyonso ya koleka bato mibale mpe akangaki banzela mpe atikaki kaka makambo ya libanda oyo zali mpeza na ntina makasi.
en-mt: On March 20, the gouvrnema said all gyms would have to close, and their workers would be paid 80% of their salaries or £2,500 a month to stop unemployment. On March 23, the prime minister introduced strict social distancing measures, cut off all gatherings of more than two people and closed roads and left only the most important outdoor activities.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: Lokola ya liboso te, mibeko oyo esengelaki esosolama na Police na kotia bato etumba mpe kopanza soki bato basangani.
en-mt: Unlike the first, these rules had to be understood by the Police by putting people in a fight and dispersing if people gathered.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: Babusiness ebele balobaki na bango bakanga, etikala kaka babusiness oyo ezali na ‘’ntina makasi’’ lekola bazando, ba pharmacy, babank, bisika ya kosomba biloko ya kosala mosala, bastation, mpe bisika ya kobatela mituka.
en-mt: Several businesses were told to close, leaving only ''essential'' businesses such as markets, pharmacies, banks, service stations, stations, and car parks.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 20 sanza ya liboso, moto ya liboso na malady ya COVID-19 azalaki na Pacific Northwest egumba ya Washington na mobali oyo autaki Wuhan mokolo ya 15 sanza ya liboso.
en-mt: On January 20, the first case of COVID-19 was in the Pacific Northwest city of Washington in a man from Wuhan on January

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: Ekipi ya Ndako ya Mpembe esalemaki mokolo ya 29 sanza ya liboso.
en-mt: The White House team was formed on January 29th.

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 31, biro ya trump elobaki ete oyo ezali likama ya kolongono, mpe bakotisaki mibeko mpona banzela ya Chine.
en-mt: On the 31st, the trump office said this was a health hazard, and introduced rules for Chinese roads.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 28 sanza ya liboso 2020, Esika ya Kolandela Bamaladi – elandani ya Institu ya kolongono ya bato mpona gouvernema ya U.S- balobaki ete basali biloko ya ekzame ya bango moko.
en-mt: On January 28, 2020, the Centers for Disease Control – a successor of the Institutes of Public Health for the US government- announced that it had developed its own test kits.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: Nsima ya kosala yango, Etats Unis ebandaki kosala ba ekzame nsima, oyo eningisaki bosolo ya pandemic nan tango oyo.
en-mt: After doing so, the United States began testing later, which shook the reality of the pandemic at this time.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: Biloko ya kosala ekzame esalemaki na gouvernema federal na sanza ya mibale, kozanga kondima ya gouvernema ya federal mpona biloko ya ekzame oyo eliki etid te (na academie, bacompanie to balepital) ti suka ya sanza ya mibale, mpe batoli mingi mpona bato oyo bakokaki komisalisa ekzame ti ebandeli ya sanza ya misato (mokanda ya monganga esengamaki).
en-mt: Testing materials were developed by the federal government in February, no federal approval for non-etid testing materials (in academia, companies or hospitals) until the end of February, and more advice for people who could help themselves exam until early March (prescription required).

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 27 sanza ya mibale, Washington Post areportaki mukie yaba ekzame 4,000 esalemaki na Etats Unis.
en-mt: On February 27, the Washington Post reported a few of the 4,000 tests conducted in the United States.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 13 sanza ya misato, Atlantic ereportaki mukie ya baekzame 14,000 esalemaki.
en-mt: On March 13, Atlantic reported a small number of 14,000 tests had been conducted.

sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 22 sanza ya misato, Associated Press ereportaki: ‘’Bato mingi oyo bazali na basymptomi mpe mokanda ya monganga bazelaki ba ngonga milayi to mikolo mpona kosala ekzame.’’ Nsima moto ya liboso oto akufaki na Etats Unis atangamaki na Washington mokolo ya 29 sanza ya mibale, gouverneur Jay Inslee abenganki yango likama ya kolongono mpona egumba, nsiima mboka mobimba elandaki yango.
en-mt: On March 22, the Associated Press reported: ''Many people with symptoms and a prescription have waited hours or days for testing.'' Then the first auto death in the United States was announced in Washington on On February 29, Governor Jay Inslee called it a health hazard for the city, after which the rest of the country followed suit.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
