en-mt: PERMISSION: CC0: No rights

sourceString: We find ourselves in remarkable circumstances this month.
targetString: Na sanza oyo tokutani mpenza na makambo ya kokamwa.
en-mt: This month we have experienced some wonderful things.

sourceString: The COVID-19 epidemic is something that makes clear our global human interconnectedness and the responsibilities we have to one another.
targetString: Maladi ya COVID-19 emonisa mpenza polele ete toza ya kosangana bamoko na basusu mpe toza na mikumba mpo na bato mosusu.
en-mt: The COVID-19 pandemic has made it very clear that we are interconnected and have responsibilities to others.

sourceString: We don’t have precedent for its challenges, but we do know that our best response relies on the sort of global empathy, cooperation, and community building that sits at the heart of this organization.
targetString: Toyebi te bampasi oyo ekobimisa te, kasi toyebi ete milende na biso ya malamu ya kobundisa yango esimbami na makasi, boyokani, mpe bato ya mboka oyo baza ntina mingi na lisanga oyo.
en-mt: We don’t know the hardships it won’t cause, but we do know that our best efforts to combat them are based on the strength, cooperation, and community members who are so important to this community.

sourceString: The camaraderie and care we have seen among all of our colleagues over email, calls, and chats is a remarkable validation of the incredible humans we are fortunate enough to work with.
targetString: Boninga mpe bolingo oyo tomoni na kati ya baninga na biso nyonso na ba email, kobenga na telefone, mpe masolo ezondimisa mpenza ete tosalaka na bato ya malamu mpenza.
en-mt: The friendliness and warmth we’ve seen in all of our partners in emails, phone calls, and conversations definitely confirms that we work with excellent people.

sourceString: I couldn’t be more grateful and proud to count you all as colleagues.
targetString: Napesa bango bino baninga nyonso matondi mingi mpe nazanga na esengo ya kotyela bino motema.
en-mt: I thank them all you friends very much and miss the pleasure of trusting you.

sourceString: Last week, someone shared with me their appreciation for our work.
targetString: Na mposo eleki, moto moko ayebisaka ngai ndenge basepelaka na mosala na biso.
en-mt: Last week, someone tells me how much they like our work.

sourceString: They reminded me how meaningful it is for the world to be able to turn to Wikipedia right now, and what a powerful symbol it is for this critical resource to remain online and available to all.
targetString: Ekundwelaki ngai ndenge eza ntina mingi ete bato bakende na Wikipedia kaka sikoyo, mpe eza elembo makasi emonisi ete misala ya ntina esengeli kozala na internet mpe bato nyonso bazala na likoki ya komona yango.
en-mt: It reminded me how important it is that people go to Wikipedia right now, and it’s a strong indication that important work should be online and accessible to everyone.

sourceString: Your work makes this possible, whether you keep the sites stay up or our colleagues paid or our communities safe.
targetString: Mosala na bino nde esalisaka mpo esalema bongo, ezala bozotya bansango ya sika na basite to kofuta baninga na biso to kobatela mboka na biso.
en-mt: Your work is what makes that happen, whether you are posting news or paying our friends or protecting our country.

sourceString: The world needs the information that Wikipedia provides, now more than ever.
targetString: Sikoyo mpenza, mokili eza na mposa ya bansango oyo Wikipedia epesaka.
en-mt: Right now, the world needs the information that Wikipedia provides.

sourceString: This is a moment in which not only what we do, but how we do it, will make a meaningful impact on the world.
targetString: Oyo eza eleko oyo makambo ekozala na ntina mingi mpo na mokili eza kaka te makambo tozosala, kasi mpe ndenge tosalaka yango.
en-mt: This is a time when things that matter most to the world are not just what we do, but also how we do it.

sourceString: Because of the importance of this mission and your role in it, we will be making some significant adjustments to how we work together, starting this coming week.
targetString: Mpo mosala oyo mpe mokumba na bino eza ntina mingi, tokobongola ndenge tosalaka elongo, kobanda na mposo oyo.
en-mt: Because this work and your responsibility is so important, we will change the way we work together, starting this week.

sourceString: Adjustments to our work and schedules
targetString: Mbongwana na mosala mpe manaka na biso
en-mt: Changes in our work and schedule

sourceString: As Robyn mentioned previously, the c-team met last night to discuss our approach and schedule for the coming days and months.
targetString: Ndenge Robyn autaki kolobela yango, etuluku c ekutanaki na butu eleki mpo na kolobela lolenge na biso ya kosala mosala mpe manaka na biso na mikolo mpe basanza ezoya.
en-mt: As Robyn just mentioned, group c met last night to discuss our approach and schedule over the coming days and months.

sourceString: In that conversation, we considered what we thought would be an appropriate response to what we’re facing and the best way to keep the organization sustainable during this time.
targetString: Na masolo wana, tolobelaka makambo oyo tokanisi eza lolenge ya malamu ya kobunda na makambo oyo tozokutana na yango mpe lolenge ya malamu ya kosala ete organisation na biso ekoba kosala na eleko oyo.
en-mt: In those conversations, we talk about what we think is the best way to tackle the issues we’re facing and the best way to ensure our organization continues to operate during this period.

sourceString: Overwhelmingly we wanted to remove stress and support our mission for the long term.
targetString: Toza na mposa ya kolongola mitungisi mpe kopesa maboko na mosala na biso mpo na ntango ya molai.
en-mt: We need to take the stress away and contribute to our work for the long term.

sourceString: If you need to dial back, that’s okay.
targetString: Soki olingi kobenga biso, eza mabe te.
en-mt: If you want to call us, it’s okay.

sourceString: For all staff, contractors, and contract workers:
targetString: Mpo na bakonzi, ba entrepreneur mpe bato ya mosala nyonso:
en-mt: For officials, contractors and all professionals:

sourceString: our daily working expectations will be about 4 hours a day, or 20 hours a week until further notice.
targetString: ngonga na biso ya mosala ya mokolo na mokolo ekozala bangonga 4, to bangonga 20 na mposo moko kino tokobongola yango.
en-mt: our daily work hours will be 4 hours, or 20 hours per week until we change it.

sourceString: We’re not declaring a holiday - if you are able to work more normal hours, the mission can use you.
targetString: Tolobi te ete bozwi congé - soki oza na likoki ya kosala bangonga mingi koleka, bakoki kosalela yo.
en-mt: We don't say you've got leave - if you're able to work more hours, you can be used.

sourceString: However, the world is unpredictable right now, and whether you need to care for loved ones, get groceries, or go to the doctor, your well-being is our priority.
targetString: Kasi, makambo ezobima na mokili eyebani te sikoyo, mpe soki ekosenga obatela moto moko oyo olingaka, okende kosomba bilei, to kokende kokutana na monganga, santé na ye esengeli kozwa esika ya liboso.
en-mt: However, the world is uncertain now, and if you have to care for a loved one, go shopping, or see a doctor, his or her health must come first.

sourceString: We are not tracking your time.
targetString: Tozolandela te ntango na yo ya mosala.
en-mt: We do not track your working hours.

sourceString: If you are sick, do not work.
targetString: Soki ozobela, koya te na mosala.
en-mt: If you are sick, don’t come to work.

sourceString: This should go without saying, but we’re saying it.
targetString: Esengeli kosalema kozanga toloba yango, kasi tozoloba yango.
en-mt: It has to happen without us saying it, but we are saying it.

sourceString: No sick days or PTO required - just tell your manager and help your team revise calendars and schedules to make sure key areas of work are covered.
targetString: Oza te na ntina ya mikolo ya maladi to PTO - yebisa kaka mokonzi na yo mpe salisa baninga ya mosala bayeba ndenge ya kobongisa manaka mpo misala ya ntina ekobaka kosalema.
en-mt: You don't need sick days or PTO - just let your boss know and help co-workers figure out how to adjust the schedule so important tasks keep getting done.

sourceString: (If you are diagnosed positive for COVID-19, please let Bryan within T&C Ops know so T&C can help with support and make sure your situation gets appropriate attention from management).
targetString: (Soki bakangi yo maladi ya COVID-19, tosengi yo oyebisa Bryan within T&C Ops ebongo T&C akoki kosunga yo mpe kosalisa yo mpo bakonzi batyela yo likebi ebongi).
en-mt: (If you are diagnosed with COVID-19, please notify Bryan within T&C Ops so T&C can assist you and help you get proper attention from the authorities).

sourceString: Hourly folks will be fully paid.
targetString: Bakofuka ngonga ya mosala nyonso.
en-mt: They will blow every working hour.

sourceString: We have already said, and are recommitting to honor our commitments to our contractors and hourly staff colleagues.
targetString: Tosi tolobaki yango, mpe tozozongeli komipesa na biso mpo na kotosa boyokani na biso na ba entrepeneur na biso mpe baninga ya mosala oyo basalaka na bangonga eyebani.
en-mt: We have already said that, and we reiterate our commitment to honor our agreements with our contractors and colleagues who work defined hours.

sourceString: Everyone will be paid on the basis of their usual hours worked during normal circumstances.
targetString: Bakofuta bato nyonso na kotalela bangonga oyo basalaka mbala na mbala ntango makambo esalemaka bo momeseno.
en-mt: All will be paid based on regular hours worked when things are normal.

sourceString: This includes if you are sick and unable to work.
targetString: Etaleli mpe soki ozobela to ozokoka te kosala.
en-mt: It also depends on whether you are sick or unable to work.

sourceString: If you want to work, we support you.
targetString: Soki olingi kosala, tokosalisa yango.
en-mt: If you want to work, we will help it.

sourceString: Many people use work as a way of channeling their stress with the world around us.
targetString: Bato mingi basalelaka mosala lokola eleko esalisaka bango na kokabola mitungisi na bango na bato oyo bakutanaka na bango.
en-mt: Many people use work as a season to help them share their concerns with the people they meet.

sourceString: What we do can be incredibly rewarding, especially during times like this.
targetString: Oyo tosalaka ekoki kosalisa mingi mpenza, mingimingi na bantango neti oyo.
en-mt: What we do can be very helpful, especially at times like these.

sourceString: Again, this is about your self-care.
targetString: Lisusu, ezotalela ndenge omibatelaka.
en-mt: Also, it depends on how you protect yourself.

sourceString: Our ask is that you communicate with your manager, so we know what to expect and can adjust accordingly.
targetString: Tozosenga ete osolola na mokonzi na yo, mpo toyeba makambo tokosala mpe nasala mbongwana ebongi.
en-mt: We ask that you talk to your boss, so that we know what we will do and make appropriate changes.

sourceString: Some work is considered essential.
targetString: Misala mosusu etalelami ete eza ya ntina mingi.
en-mt: Some activities are considered critical.

sourceString: There are some things that we must keep doing.
targetString: Eza na makambo mosusu oyo tosengeli kokoba kosala.
en-mt: There’s some things we need to continue to do.

sourceString: The SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising teams (among others) do critical work that may need additional support.
targetString: Masanga ya SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising (na kati na yango) esalaka misala ya ntina oyo ekoki kosenga lisungi mosusu.
en-mt: The SRE, HR Ops, Trust & Safety, and Fundraising groups (including) perform important functions that may require additional support.

sourceString: We’ll begin a process with all departments to assess current objectives and shift our focus to supporting what’s essential for our mission.
targetString: Tokobanda mosala moko na badepartema nyonso mpo na koyeba mikano na biso ya sika mpe kotya likebi sikoyo na kopesa maboko na makambo ya ntina ya mosala na biso.
en-mt: We will embark on a process across all departments to identify our new objectives and focus now on contributing to the core areas of our work.

sourceString: There’s plenty to do for all of us, we just will all focus on the most essential projects.
targetString: Biso nyonso toza na mosala mingi, kasi tokotya likebi na misala ya ntina mingi.
en-mt: We are all busy, but we will focus on the more important tasks.

sourceString: Slowing now won’t hurt later.
targetString: Kolembisa sikoyo ekosala biso mpasi te na nsima.
en-mt: Tiring out now won’t hurt us later.

sourceString: We do not plan to go “double-time to catch up” once the pandemic has passed.
targetString: Toza te na likanisi ya “kosala mbala mibale koleka mpo na ko recuperer” soki maladi esili.
en-mt: We don’t have the idea of “working twice as hard to recover” once the illness is gone.

sourceString: You will not be expected to work extra hours to meet deadlines which are now unrealistic.
targetString: Tokosenga biso te bosalaka ba heure supplémentaire mpo na kosilisa mosala na badate na yango oyo eza ntina te sikoyo.
en-mt: We will not ask you to work overtime to complete the work on dates that are not necessary now.

sourceString: We accept that circumstances have changed, and will work to set new targets and timelines where appropriate.
targetString: Tozondima ete makambo ebongwani, mpe tokobongisa makambo mpo na komityela mikano ya sika mpe badate bisika oyo eza mpenza ntina.
en-mt: We will acknowledge that things have changed, and we will adjust to set new goals and dates where they really matter.

sourceString: What happens with the APP (Annual Planning)?
targetString: Nini ekokomela APP (planification annuelle)?
en-mt: What will happen to the APP (annual planning)?

sourceString: To adjust to our new reality and daily working hour expectations, we intend to adjust the timeline for the delivery of our 2020-2021 Annual Plan.
targetString: Mpo komesana na makambo ya sika mpe bangonga ya mosala ya mokolo na mokolo, tozolinga kobongola ntango oyo tokobimisa planification annuelle na biso ya 2020-2021.
en-mt: To adapt to new conditions and daily working hours, we are planning to change the timing of the release of our 2020-2021 annual planning.

sourceString: Our intention is to propose an extension of our 2019-2020 plan that allows more time for budgeting to allow employees to prioritize critical work, self-care, and care for loved ones while accommodating those who need or wish to work a reduced schedule over the next few weeks.
targetString: Likanisi na biso eza ya kosenga babakisa mikolo na planification na biso ya mobu 2019-2020 mpo tozala na likoki ya kobongisa makambo ya mbongo oyo ekosalisa bato na biso ya mosala batya likebi nanu na misala ya ntina, komibatela, mpe kobatela bato oyo balingaka ntango tozotalela baoyo basengeli to balingi kosala ngonga moko na bamposo ezoya.
en-mt: Our intent is to request an extension to our 2019-2020 planning so that we are able to make financial arrangements that will help our workforce first focus on essential services, protecting ourselves, and caring for loved ones while we care those who need or want to work an hour in the coming weeks.

sourceString: This timeline extension greatly reduces current planning workloads and pressure across the whole organization.
targetString: Kobakisa mikolo ekotisa mpenza mosala ya kobongisa makambo ya sikoyo mpe pression na organisation mobimba.
en-mt: Extending the dates will definitely introduce current processing and pressure across the organization.

sourceString: We will introduce our proposal to the Board next week and will update delegates and teams on the next steps as soon as we have confirmation.
targetString: Tokotinda likanisi na biso na bakonzi na mposo ezoya mpe koyebisa mimonisi mpe ba-ekipe na biso makambo ya kosala nsima soki tozwi eyano ya bakonzi.
en-mt: We will send our proposal to the authorities next week and inform our representatives and teams of the next steps once we receive a response from the authorities.

sourceString: Thank you to the APP team for your leadership in this.
targetString: Topesa matondi na ekipe ya APP ndenge bokambi misala oyo.
en-mt: We thank the APP team for leading these activities.

sourceString: Office status, exposure, and cleaning
targetString: Statut ya biro, kozala na likama ya maladi, mpe kotya bopeto
en-mt: Office status, exposure to disease, and establishing hygiene

sourceString: Last week, we learned that one of our SF-based colleagues may have been exposed to the COVID-19 virus.
targetString: Na mposo eleki, bayebisaki biso ete mbala mosusu moninga na biso moko akutanaki na moto moko oyo aza na virisi COVID-19.
en-mt: Last week, we were told that a friend of ours may have been in contact with someone with the COVID-19 virus.

sourceString: However, out of an abundance of caution, we employed an antiviral cleaning crew to disinfect all surfaces in the San Francisco office.
targetString: Kasi, mpo na kokeba makasi, tosalelaki nkisi ebomaka virisi mpo na kopetola bisika nyonso na biro ya Francisco.
en-mt: However, as a precaution, we used disinfectant to clean everywhere in Francisco's office.

sourceString: They utilized a hospital-grade anti-viral solution to disinfect every surface, as well as the lobby and elevator banks accessing our floor.
targetString: Basalelaki nkisi ya koboma mikrobe oyo basalelaka na balopitalo mpo na kopetola bisika nyonso, eza esika ya kokotela mpe ba elevateur oyo ememaka na biro na biso.
en-mt: Hospital disinfectants were used to clean everywhere, including the entrance and the elevators that lead to our office.

sourceString: The building is employing its own duty-of-care protocol utilizing products that support the safety of their tenants.
targetString: Basalelaka ndako yango esalelaka mibeko na yango moko.
en-mt: They use the building uses its own rules.

sourceString: We feel comfortable that the office will be well-prepared for when we decide to return.
targetString: Toza motema ya kokita mpo toyebi ete biro ekozala malamu mpenza ntango tokozonga kuna.
en-mt: We are relieved because we know the office will be perfectly fine when we get back there.

sourceString: Our DC office is located in a WeWork, which has shared its COVID-19 protocol with us and all DC-based staff members.
targetString: Biro na biso ya DC eza na WeWork, oyo eyebisi biso mibeko na bango ya komibatela COVID-19 mpe epesi yango na basali nyonso ya DC.
en-mt: Our DC office has WeWork, which informs us of their COVID-19 safety policies and provides them to all DC employees.

sourceString: As of last week, our DC office moved to a fully remote setup in line with the guidance shared with San Francisco.
targetString: Na mposo eleki, babongisaki biro na biso ya DC mpo bato babanda kosala mosika na kolanda litambwisi oyo eutaki na San Francisco.
en-mt: Last week, our DC office was upgraded so people could start working remotely following the guidance from San Francisco.

sourceString: As some of our NYC-based colleagues know, we have also been in discussion about leasing a location in Brooklyn.
targetString: Ndenge baninga na biso mosusu ya NYC bayebi, tozalaki mpe na masolo mpo na koluka esika na Brooklyn.
en-mt: As some of our NYC friends know, we were also in talks about finding a location in Brooklyn.

sourceString: These discussions are continuing but may be delayed.
targetString: Masolo oyo ezolandaka kasi oyo kozela.
en-mt: Ongoing stories but wait.

sourceString: Some of our colleagues are working remotely for the first time.
targetString: Baninga na biso mosusu bazosala na mosika mpo na mbala ya liboso.
en-mt: Some of our friends are working remotely for the first time.

sourceString: Our long-time remote colleagues know that it can be an adjustment, and wanted to offer you some advice:
targetString: Baninga na biso ya kala oyo basalaka mosika bayebi ete ekoki kozala mbongwana, mpe tolingaki kopesa bino mwa batoli:
en-mt: Our longtime remote colleagues know it can be a change, and we wanted to give you some tips:

sourceString: Limit the length of meetings to at most one or two hour increments.
targetString: Kosala ete makita ezwa ngonga moko to mibale.
en-mt: Keep meetings to an hour or two.

sourceString: If longer sessions are required, consider how they can be broken up over the course of several days.
targetString: Soki esengeli kozwa ntango mingi, botala soki bokoki kosala yango mokemoke na mikolo mingi.
en-mt: If it takes more time, see if you can do it gradually over several days.

sourceString: Clearly define the meeting, have an agenda, and send reading materials in advance.
targetString: Boyeba polele ntina ya likita, makambo bokolobela, mpe botinda makambo ya kokanga na liboso.
en-mt: Clearly identify the purpose of the meeting, what you will discuss, and send closing details up front.

sourceString: Make video the default, with tools like Google Docs and Zoom to facilitate live collaboration and connection.
targetString: Boyebisa video oyo bakosalela, na bisaleli neti Google Doc mpe Zoom mpo masolo ya en direct eleka malamu mpe connection eza bien.
en-mt: Specify the video they will use, with tools like Google Doc and Zoom to make the live chat go smoothly and the connection is good.

sourceString: Have a lead to facilitate every meeting, someone to monitor the chat for questions and track the speaker list, and someone to help take notes (or do collaborative note-taking).
targetString: Bozala na mokambi mpo likita nyonso esalema malamu, moto oyo akoyanola na chat mpo na mituna oyo bazotuna mpe bapiste oyo eza na liste ya balobi, mpe moto oyo ekosalisa na kozwa banote (to bosalisana na kozwa banote).
en-mt: Have a moderator to keep every meeting running smoothly, someone to answer the chat for FAQs and tracks on the speaker list, and someone to help take notes (or help each other take notes).

sourceString: Send an email to tech support if you need a comfortable headset.
targetString: Botindela ba support informatique email soki boza na mposa ya ba écouteur ya malamu.
en-mt: Please email computer support if you need better headphones.

sourceString: Use your wellness reimbursement for snacks.
targetString: Bosalela mbongo ya bien être mpo na bilei.
en-mt: Use welfare money for food.

sourceString: Join the #remoties channel in Slack to talk with your colleagues about distributed work
targetString: Kota na chaine #remoties na Slack mpo na kosolola na baninga na yo na ntina na mosala
en-mt: Join the #remoties channel on Slack to chat with your friends about the project

sourceString: The HR Operations team is looking into webinar-based ergonomics guidance to support the increase in distributed work across the Foundation.
targetString: Ekipi ya HR ezozela makita ya internet mpo na litambwisi ekosalisa na kolandela mosala ya mingi oyo eza mpo na Fondation.
en-mt: The HR team looks forward to online meetings for guidance will help monitor the overwhelming workload available to the Foundation.

sourceString: This past week we asked all community grant recipients to cancel Wikimedia-funded public events, such as editathons, until the WHO declares the pandemic to be over.
targetString: Na mposo eleki, toyebisaka bato nyonso na kokata makutani nyonso ya bato nyonso oyo Wikipedia efutaka mbongo, na ndakisa editathons, kino ntango OMS akoloba maladi mabe esili.
en-mt: Last week, we informed the public by canceling all Wikipedia-sponsored public gatherings, such as editathons, until the WHO declared the plague over.

sourceString: We let them know that we understood that our request for cancellations and other restrictions could make it impossible to complete their agreed-upon grant activities and that no one would be penalized for having to delay or modify those goals.
targetString: Tokoyebisa bango ete toyebi ete kosenga kokata makutani wana mpe bipekiseli mosusu ekoki kosala ete ezala mpasi na kosala makambo oyo toyokanaki mpe ekozala foti ya moto moko te ndenge topusi date to tobongoli mikano oyo.
en-mt: We will let them know that we recognize that requesting these appointments and other restrictions may make it difficult to carry out our agreements and that it is not anyone's fault that we have postponed or changed these meetings.

sourceString: This coming week we will follow up with additional guidance on Wikimania and other regional and thematic community conferences.
targetString: Na mposo ezoya, tokotya mibeko mosusu na Wikimania mpe na makita mosusu ya bituka mpe ya mito ya makambo.
en-mt: Next week, we will post more rules at Wikimania and other regional and thematic meetings.

sourceString: The general sentiment from around the global community seems to be both sadness at the disruption but relief at the clarity and ability to focus on their own communities, Wikimedia and otherwise.
targetString: Mayoki ya bato na biso ya mokili mobimba eza ya mawa ndenge tokati misala oyo kasi motema ekiti na bandimbola mpe makoki ya kotya likebi na bituluku na bango, Wikimedia, mpe makambo mosusu.
en-mt: The feelings of our people around the world are sad that we have cut these services but relieved by the explanations and the ability to focus on their groups, Wikimedia, and other things.

sourceString: Going forward, the CRT is working to set up a page on Meta-Wiki to provide a space for the community to monitor the impact and follow our communications with them.
targetString: Mpo na kokokisa yango, CRT ezali komilengela mpo na kosala nkasa ya Meta-Wiki mpo kopesa bituluku esika ya kolandela bopusi mpe masolo na biso na bango.
en-mt: To this end, CRT is preparing to create Meta-Wiki pages to give groups a place to track our impact and conversations with them.

sourceString: Staying in touch around COVID-19 related issues
targetString: Kokoba koyeba makambo etali COVID-19
en-mt: Keep up to date with COVID-1

sourceString: We’ll be sending an invitation to your calendars for next Thursday, 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT for a special staff meeting.
targetString: Tokotinda libyangi na kalandrie na biso na mokolo ya minei, na , 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT mpo na likita ya ntina ya bato ya mosala.
en-mt: We will send out an invitation in our calendar on Thursday, at , 14:00 UTC/07:00 PT for an important staff meeting.

sourceString: We’ll use this time to share additional updates, answer your questions and spend some time connecting with each other.
targetString: Tokosalela ngonga wana mpo na koyebisa bino makambo mosusu ya sika, kopesa biyano na mituna na bino mpe kolekisa ntango na mokomoko na bino.
en-mt: We will use that time to update you, answer your questions, and spend time with each of you.

sourceString: We’re in this together and here to help however we can.
targetString: Toza elongo na likambo oyo mpe kosalisa bino na ndenge tokoki.
en-mt: We are with this and helping you as much as we can.

sourceString: In the meantime, you can continue to find the information from this email, and all other essential COVID-19 related information, on Office Wiki.
targetString: Ntango bozozela, bokoki kokoba kolanda nsango eza na email oyo, mpe bansango mosusu ya ntina etali COVID-19, na Office Wiki.
en-mt: While you wait, you can continue to follow the information in this email, and other important information about COVID-19, on the Office Wiki.

sourceString: The CRT will keep these pages updated and all the information in one place.
targetString: CRT ekokoba kotya bansango ya sika na bankasa oyo mpe kotya bansango nyonso esika moko.
en-mt: CRT will continue to update these pages and put all the information together.

sourceString: We are also working to maintain regular communications with staff who reside in countries that are currently significantly affected.
targetString: Tozosala mpe makasi mpo na kokoba kosolola na bato na biso oyo bafandaka na mikili oyo maladi ebeti bango makasi.
en-mt: We are also working hard to keep in touch with our people living in countries that have been hit hard by the disease.

sourceString: If you have any questions about travel, events, a major workstream, or coverage challenge, or anything else you may need help with, please don’t hesitate to notify and work with the CRT.
targetString: Soki boza na motuna na nyonso etali mobembo, makita, mosala, to lolenge ya kolonga bampasi, to likambo nyonso mosusu oyo ezosenga lisalisi, bokakatana te na koyebisa mpe kosala elonga na CRT.
en-mt: If you have any questions about travel, meetings, work, or how to cope with adversity, or anything else that requires help, please do not hesitate to let CRT know and make a success of it.

sourceString: We’re here to help provide support and liaise as needed.
targetString: Tozali wana mpo kopesa lisungi mpe lisalisi soki esengeli.
en-mt: We are there to provide support and assistance if needed.

sourceString: If you have a confidential or sensitive matter, please email Bryan Judan - Director of HR International Global Operations.
targetString: Soki oza na likambo ya sekele to ya ntina, komela Bryan Judan - diretere ya misala ya mokili mobimba ya HR.
en-mt: If you have a confidential or sensitive issue, please contact Bryan Judan - global HR operations director.

sourceString: None of these changes should be seen as an abandonment of our work and obligations.
targetString: Moto moko te asengeli komona bambongwana oyo neti kotika mikumba mpe mosala na biso.
en-mt: No one should see these changes as giving up our responsibilities and work.

sourceString: Rather, they are a recognition that at this moment, our work and obligations will likely need to adapt in a way we have not in the past.
targetString: Kasi, ezali kondima ete na eleko oyo, mosala mpe mikumba na biso ekobongwana na ndenge oyo ebongwana nanu te.
en-mt: Rather, it is an acknowledgment that in this era, our work and responsibilities will change in ways that have never changed before.

sourceString: These are the steps we believe are necessary to support this one another so that we can continue to work, provide our movement with the support they need, and the world with the service they rely on.
targetString: Eza bitambe oyo tokanisi eza ntina mpo na kosalisana mpo tokoba kosala, kopesa etuluku na biso lisungi eza na yango mposa, mpe kosalela mokili mosala oyo etyelaka motema.
en-mt: They are steps we think are important to help each other keep working, give our group the support it needs, and serve the world the work it trusts.

sourceString: Our planned work will be there waiting for us when the time comes.
targetString: Mosala na biso oyo tobongisa ekozela biso kino ntango ekokoka.
en-mt: Our prepared work will await us until the time is right.

sourceString: For now, it is time to support one another and create space for the important work that will be coming in the weeks and potentially months ahead.
targetString: Sikoyo eza ntango ya kosalisana mpe kosala bisika mpo na mosala ya ntina oyo ekoya na bamposo mpe mbala mosusu na basanza ezoya.
en-mt: Now is the time to help each other and make room for the important work that will come in the weeks and perhaps months ahead.

sourceString: We need all of you to make that happen, and so we need you all to take care of yourself and your families so that you can be at your best when the need arises.
targetString: Toza na mposa na bino nyonso mpo esalema, yango wana tozosenga bino nyonso bomibatela mpe bobatela mabota na bino mpo bazala mpenza makasi ntango mposa ekozala.
en-mt: We need all of you to make it happen, so we’re asking you all to take care of yourselves and your families to be really strong when the need arises.

sourceString: Now, please -- wash your hands and don’t touch your face!
targetString: Sikoyo, tosengi biso -- bosukola maboko mpe bosimba elongi te!
en-mt: Now, please -- wash your hands and don't touch your face!

sourceString: Katherine, the CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), and the rest of the Leadership Team (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, and Toby N).
targetString: Katherine, CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, mpe Tony S), mpe ekipe mobimba ya bakambi (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V, Janeen U, Lisa S, Robyn A, Ryan M, na Toby N).
en-mt: Katherine, CRT (Amanda K, Amy V, Bryan J, Doreen D, Gregory V, Jaime V, Joel L, Lynette L, Ryan M, and Tony S), and the entire leadership team (Grant I, Heather W, Jaime V). , Janeen U , Lisa S , Robyn A , Ryan M , and Toby N ).

sourceString: b'Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme attached to the outer surface (cell membranes) of cells in the lungs, arteries, heart, kidney, and intestines.
targetString: Angiotensin ezali kokoma enzyme 2 (ACE2) ezali enzyme moko oyo ezali na libanda ya (membranes ya cellule) mimpulupulu, misisa, motema, bangei na misopo.
en-mt: Angiotensin is becoming enzyme 2 (ACE2) is an enzyme found in the outer (cell membranes) of the lungs, muscles, heart, spleen and kidneys.

sourceString: ACE2 counters the activity of the related angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) by reducing the amount of angiotensin-II and increasing Ang(1-7) making it a promising drug target for treating cardiovascular diseases.ACE2 also serves as the entry point into cells for some coronaviruses.
targetString: ACE2 ekangaka mosala ya kobalola angiotensin na enzyme (ACE) na kokitisa boni ya engiotensin-II mpe komatisa ang(1-7) kokomisa yango kisi y amakasi mpona kosalisa maladi ya motema. ACE2 mpe esalisamaka mpona kokota bacoronavirisi.
en-mt: ACE2 inhibits the conversion of angiotensin to enzyme (ACE) by reducing the amount of angiotensin-II and increasing ang(1-7) making it a potent drug for the treatment of heart disease. ACE2 is also used to enter coronaviruses.

sourceString: The human version of the enzyme is often referred to as hACE2.
targetString: Enzyme ya nzoto ya bato ebengami hACE2.
en-mt: The human body enzyme is designated hACE2.

sourceString: Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 is a zinc containing metalloenzyme located on the surface of endothelial and other cells.
targetString: Angiotensin kokoma enzyme 2 ezali metalloenzyme oyo ezali na Zinx na likolo ya endothelial mpe bacellule misusu.
en-mt: Angiotensin becoming enzyme 2 is a metalloenzyme that contains Zinx on the surface of endothelial and other cells.

sourceString: ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 domain and a C-terminal collectrin renal amino acid transporter domain.
targetString: Protein ya ACE2 ezali na N-terminal peptidase M2 mpe C-terminal ya kozwa ya zolo ya komema amono acid.
en-mt: The ACE2 protein contains an N-terminal peptidase M2 and a C-terminal receptive nose ammono acid carrier.

sourceString: ACE2 is a single-pass type I membrane protein, with its enzymatically active domain exposed on the surface of cells in lungs and other tissues.
targetString: ACE2 esali type ya membrane ya protein kaka ya moko, na mosala na ye ya kokoma enzyme na libanda ya bacellule mpe baposo misusu.
en-mt: ACE2 forms a protein membrane type of only one, with its function of becoming an enzyme on the outside of cells and other weeks.

sourceString: The extracellular domain of ACE2 is cleaved from the transmembrane domain by another enzyme known as sheddase, and the resulting soluble protein is released into the blood stream and ultimately excreted into urine.
targetString: Esika ya extracellular ya ACE2 euti na transmembrane na enzyme mosusu oyo babengi sheddase, nsima protein ekobima ekokota makila nsima ekobima na nzela ya masuba.
en-mt: The extracellular site of ACE2 is derived from the transmembrane by another enzyme called sheddase, then the protein will be released into the bloodstream then excreted through the urine.

sourceString: ACE2 is present in most organs: ACE2 is attached to the cell membrane of mainly lung type II alveolar cells, enterocytes of the small intestine, arterial and venous endothelial cells and arterial smooth muscle cells in most organs.
targetString: ACE2 ezali na kati ya baorgan mingi: ACE2 ekangami na membrane ya cellule ya mimpulupulu ya type II ya bacellule ya alveolarenterocytes ya misopo ya moke, misisa mpe bavein ya endothelial mpe muscle ya pete ya cellule ya misisa na baorgans.
en-mt: ACE2 is present in many organs: ACE2 is bound to the lung type II cell membrane of small intestinal alveolarenterocyte cells, endothelial vessels and vessels and vascular cell smooth muscle in organs.

sourceString: ACE2 mRNA expression is also found in the cerebral cortex, striatum, hypothalamus, and brainstem.
targetString: ACE2 mRNA ezali mpe na cortez, striatum, ypothalamus, mpe brainstem.
en-mt: ACE2 mRNA is also present in the cortex, striatum, ypothalamus, and brainstem.

sourceString: The primary function of ACE2 is to act as a counter balance to ACE.
targetString: Mosala ya liboso ya aCE2 ezali kosala mosala ya ACE.
en-mt: The primary function of aCE2 is to activate ACE.

sourceString: ACE cleaves angiotensin I hormone into the vasoconstricting  angiotensin II.
targetString: ACE ekangisaka ba hormone ya I ya angiotensin na vasoconstriction ya angiotensin II.
en-mt: ACE binds angiotensin I hormones and angiotensin II vasoconstriction.

sourceString: ACE2 in turn cleaves the carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine from angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-Phe) and hydrolyses it into the vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
targetString: ACE2 ekangamaka na carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine na angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-pPhe) mpe kohydrolyse yango na kati ya vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).
en-mt: ACE2 binds to the carboxyl-terminal amino acid phenylalanine in angiotensin II (Asp-Arg-Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-pPhe) and cohydrolyzes it into the vasodilator angiotensin (1-7), (H-Asp-Arg-Val- Tyr-Ile-His-Pro-OH).

sourceString: ACE2 can also cleave a number of other peptides including [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.
targetString: ACE2 ekoki mpe kokangama na bapeptides mingi lekola [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, na ghrelin.
en-mt: ACE2 can also bind to several peptides such as [des-Arg9]-bradykinin, apelin, neurotensin, dynorphin A, and ghrelin.

sourceString: ACE2 also regulates the membrane trafficking of the neutral amino acid transporter SLC6A19 and has been implicated in Hartnup's disease.
targetString: ACE2 ebongisaka mpe embouteillage ya membrane ya neutral amino acid oyo ememaka SLC6A19 mpe ezalaki na maladi ya Hartnup.
en-mt: ACE2 also regulates membrane packing of neutral amino acid carrying SLC6A19 and was present in Hartnup disease.

sourceString: As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 serves as the main entry point into cells for some coronaviruses, including HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (the virus that causes SARS); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus that causes COVID-19).
targetString: Lekola protein ya transmembrane, ACE2 ezali esika ya liboso ya kokota ya bacellule ya coronavirisi, mpe HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (virisi oyo SARS euti); mpe SARS-CoV-2 (virisi oyo COVID-19 euti).
en-mt: As a transmembrane protein, ACE2 is the primary cell entry site for coronaviruses, and HCoV-NL63; SARS-CoV (SARS-derived virus); and SARS-CoV-2 (the virus from which COVID-19 is caused).

sourceString: More specifically, the binding of the spike S1 protein of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 to the enzymatic domain of ACE2 on the surface of cells results in endocytosis and translocation of both the virus and the enzyme into endosomes located within cells.
targetString: Na kososola malamu, kokangama ya nsonge ya protein ya S1 ya SARS-CoV na SARS-CoV2 na enzyme ya ACE2 na likolo ya bacellule ekomema endocytosis mpe kotambwisa virisi ya enzyme elongo moko na kati ya endosomes oyo ezali na kati ya bacellule.
en-mt: Intuitively, binding of the S1 protein peak of SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV2 to the ACE2 enzyme on the cell surface would lead to endocytosis and guidance of the enzyme virus together into intracellular endosomes.

sourceString: This entry process also requires priming of the S protein by the host serine protease TMPRSS2, the inhibition of which is under current investigation as a potential therapeutic.This has led some to hypothesize that decreasing the levels of ACE2, in cells, might help in fighting the infection.
targetString: Esika ya kokota oyo esengi kobongisa protein S na serine protease TMPRSS2, oyo ezali bazali kososola therapy oyo ekoki kosimba. Oyo etindi bato misusu bakitisa ACE2, na kati ya bacellules, mpona komeka kobundela infection.
en-mt: This entry point requires the conversion of protein S to the serine protease TMPRSS2, which is are understood potential therapy. This has led some people to lower ACE2, in cells, to try to fight infection.

sourceString: However, multiple professional societies and regulatory bodies have recommended continuing standard ACE inhibitor and ARB therapy.
targetString: Kasi, basociete mini ya bayekoli mpe ya mibeko balobi ete esengeli bakenda kaka liboso na ACE oyo esengami mpe na therapie ya ARB.
en-mt: However, the academic and legal mini-societies say they should still go ahead with the recommended ACE and ARB therapy.

sourceString: A systematic review and meta-analysis published on July 11, 2012, found that "use of ACE inhibitors was associated with a significant 34% reduction in risk of pneumonia compared with controls."
targetString: Lisosoli moko ya system mpe ya etid-ya-meta oyo babimisaki na mokolo ya 11 sanza ya nsambo 2012 emonaki ete ‘’kosalisa ACE ekokitisa na 34% chance ya pneumonia’’.
en-mt: A system and etid-ya-meta opinion published on July 11, 2012 found that ''ACE treatment will reduce by 34% the chance of pneumonia''.

sourceString: Moreover, "the risk of pneumonia was also reduced in patients treated with ACE inhibitors who were at higher risk of pneumonia, in particular those with stroke and heart failure.
targetString: Kasi mpe, ‘’risk ya pneumonia ekitaki mpe na bato oyo basalisaki bango na ACE bato oyo bakokaki kozwa pneumonia noki, lekola ba oyo bazalaki kobela motema.
en-mt: But also, ''the risk of pneumonia also decreased in people treated with ACE people who could develop pneumonia earlier, such as those with heart disease.

sourceString: Use of ACE inhibitors was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia related mortality, although the results were less robust than for overall risk of pneumonia."
targetString: Kosalisa ACE esanganaki mpe na kokitisa pneumonia mpo bato bakufa te, kasi baresulta ezalaki makasi mingi te na oyo ya risk ya pneumonia.’’
en-mt: ACE treatment was also associated with a reduction in pneumonia so that people didn't die, but the results were less robust than those for pneumonia risk.''

sourceString: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) is surmised to be a novel therapy for acute lung injury, and appeared to improve pulmonary hemodynamics and oxygen saturation in piglets with a lipopolysaccharide-induced acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Recombinant ya bato ACE2 (rhACE2) ezali therapie ya sika mpona mpasi ya mimpulupulu, mpe ezalaki kosalisa pulmonary hemodynaci mpe ekotonda ya oxygen na kati ya bangulu na lypopolysaccharie kati ya syndrome ya mpasi ya kopema.
en-mt: Recombinant human ACE2 (rhACE2) is a new therapy for lung disease, and has been used to treat pulmonary hemodynaci and oxygen saturation in pigs with lypopolysaccharia in respiratory distress syndrome.

sourceString: The half-life of rhACE2 in human beings is about 10 hours and the onset of action is 30 minutes in addition to the course of effect (duration) of 24 hours.
targetString: Bomoi ya moke ya rhACE2 na kati ya bato ezali bangonga 10 mpe ekosala mosala na baminute 30 elongo moko na ngonga 24.
en-mt: The minimum lifespan of rhACE2 in humans is 10 hours and it will work for 30 minutes together with 24 hours.

sourceString: Several findings suggest that rhACE2 may be a promising drug for those with intolerance to classic renin-angiotensin system inhibitors (RAS inhibitors) or in diseases where circulating angiotensin II is elevated.Infused rhACE2 has been evaluated in clinical trials for the treatment of acute respiratory distress syndrome.
targetString: Ba etid mingi elobi ete rhACE2 ekoki kozala kisi ya malamu mpona ba oyo nzoto eboyi renin-angiotensin (RAS inhibitors) to bamaldi angiotensin oyo ezali kotambo ezali makasi. rhACE2 esosolami na kati ya clinic mpona kosalisa maladi ya mpasi ya kopema.
en-mt: Many etid suggest that rhACE2 may be a good treatment for those who are renin-angiotensin resistant (RAS inhibitors) or patients with severe circulating angiotensin. rhACE2 is understood in the clinic for the treatment of respiratory distress syndrome.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 apps are mobile software applications designed to aid contact tracing in response to the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic, i.e. the process of identifying persons ("contacts") who may have been in contact with an infected individual.
targetString: B’COVID-19 apps ezali baaplication ya telephone oyo esalemi mpona kolanda bato oyo bakoki kozala na maladi ya pandemi ya coronavirisi ya 2019-20. Lekola, ndenge ya koyeba (‘’bato’’) oyo bakokaki kozala esika moko na moto oyo azalaki na maladi.
en-mt: B'COVID-19 apps are mobile applications designed to track potential cases of the 2019-20 coronavirus pandemic. Measure, how to identify (''people'') who may have been in contact with the patient.

sourceString: Numerous applications were developed or proposed, with official government support in some territories and jurisdictions.
targetString: Baaplication mingi esalemaki, mpe na lisungi ya gouvernema na bisika misusu.
en-mt: Many applications were developed, also with government support elsewhere.

sourceString: Several frameworks for building contact tracing apps have been developed.
targetString: Ba ndenge mingi ya kolandela bato esalemaki na baaplication ya telephone.
en-mt: Many forms of tracking have been implemented in mobile applications.

sourceString: Privacy concerns have been raised, especially about systems that are based on tracking the geographical location of app users.
targetString: Bato basepekali te na ndenge ezali kotia miso na basekele ya bato, lekola basystem oyo ezali kolanda esika oyo bato bazali.
en-mt: People are not happy with the way it is eyeing people’s secrets, like location-tracking systems.

sourceString: Less intrusive alternatives include the use of Bluetooth signals to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: Ya kotia miso mingi te na kati ya basekele ya bato ezali basignal ya Bluetooth oyo ekoyebisa moto soki azali pene na ba telephone misusu.
en-mt: Not to put too many eyes into people's secrets are Bluetooth signals that will tell someone if they are near other phones.

sourceString: On 10 April 2020, Google and Apple jointly announced that they would integrate functionality to support such Bluetooth-based apps directly into their Android and iOS operating systems.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 10 sanza ya minei 2020, Google na Apple balobaki ete bakotia basystem ya kosunga application ya Bluetooth wana na kati ya Android na iOS.
en-mt: On April 10, 2020, Google and Apple said that they would include systems to support that Bluetooth application within Android and iOS.

sourceString: In China, the Chinese government, in conjunction with Alipay, has deployed an app that allows citizens to check if they have been in contact with people that have COVID-19.
targetString: Na Chine, gouvernema ya Chine, elongo moko na Alipay, esali application oyo esungi bato ya mboka koyeba soki bazalaki pene na moto oyo azali na COVID-19.
en-mt: In China, the Chinese government, together with Alipay, has developed an application that helps citizens know if they have been close to someone with COVID-1

sourceString: It is in use across more than 200 Chinese cities.In Singapore, an app called TraceTogether is being used.
targetString: Ezali kosalema kati na bigumba 200 na Chine, na Singapore, application moko nkombo TraceTogether ezali kosalema.
en-mt: Taking place among 200 cities in China, in Singapore, an application named TraceTogether is taking place.

sourceString: The app was developed by local IT community, released as open source and will be handed over to the government.North Macedonia launched "StopKorona!", a Bluetooth-based app to trace exposure with potentially infected persons and  provide a fast response to healthcare authorities.
targetString: Bato ya mayele ya IT na kati ya egumba moto basalaki application yango, babimisaki yango mpona moto nyonso asalisa mpe bako pesa yango na gouvernema. Macedoine ya Nord ebimisaki ‘’StopKorona!’’, application ya Bluetooth oyo ekomona soki moto amipesi na maladi epayi ya moto oyo azali na maladi mpe kosunga etumba ya gouvernema na kolongono.
en-mt: IT professionals in the city developed the application, released it for everyone to use and will submit it to the government. Northern Macedonia launched ''StopKorona!'', a Bluetooth application that will detect if a person has transmitted the disease to someone who is sick and support the government's fight against health.

sourceString: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology and Ministry of Health.
targetString: App esalemaki na Minisere ya Communication mpe ya Technologie na Ministere ya Kolongono.
en-mt: The app was developed by the Ministry of Communication and Technology in the Ministry of Health.

sourceString: As of 14 April 2020, the app was awaiting approval by the Google Play Store and Apple App Store.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 14 sanza ya minei 2020, application ezalaki kozela endimelo ya Google Play na ya Apple App Store.
en-mt: As of April 14, 2020, the application was awaiting Google Play and Apple App Store approval.

sourceString: On 12 April, the government stated that the contact tracing app was in an advanced stage of development, and would be available for deployment within weeks.A similar app is planned in Ireland, and in France ("StopCovid").
targetString: Na mokolo ya 12 sanza ya minei, gouvernema elobaki application ya kolandela bato ekomaki mosika, mpe bakokoka kosalela yango na ba poso oyo ezali koyaka. Application mosusu ya boye ezali kosalema na Ireland, mpe na France (‘’StopCovid’’).
en-mt: On April 12, the government said the tracking application had come a long way, and they would be able to use it in the coming weeks. Another such app is being implemented in Ireland, and in France (''StopCovid'').

sourceString: Both Australia and New Zealand are considering apps based on Singapore's TraceTogether app and BlueTrace protocol.Russia intends to introduce a geofencing app for patients diagnosed with COVID-19 living in Moscow, designed to ensure they do not leave home.
targetString: Australie na Nouvelle Zealand balingi kosalela application oyo ezali na Singapore TraceTogether mpe BlueTrace protocol. Russie ezali kosala application oyo ekomona bato oyo bazali na COVID-19 oyo bazali kofanda na Moscow, ekosalema mpona kolandela bango mpo ete babima libanda ya ndako te.
en-mt: Australia and New Zealand plan to use an application that includes Singapore TraceTogether and BlueTrace protocol. Russia is developing an application that will detect people with COVID-19 living in Moscow, will be used to track them so they don’t leave their homes.

sourceString: Ross Anderson, professor of security engineering at Cambridge University, listed a number of potential practical problems with app-based systems, including false positives and the potential lack of effectiveness if takeup of the app is limited to only a small fraction of the population.
targetString: Ross Anderson, molakisi ya securite ya ingenieur na universite ya Cambridge, ayebisaki makambo mingi oyo ekoki kosalema na ba system ya application oyo, lekola bapositives ya lekuta, mpe mpasi mpona etambola malamu mpo ete application ekoki kosalisa kaka bato ndabo ya mboka.
en-mt: Ross Anderson, professor of engineering security at the University of Cambridge, described many of the potential issues with these application systems, such as false positives, and the difficulty of running smoothly because the application can only serve local people.

sourceString: Addressing concerns about the spread of misleading or harmful "coronavirus" apps, Apple set limits on which types of organizations could add coronavirus-related apps to its App Store, limiting them to only "official" or otherwise reputable organizations.
targetString: Kolandela mitungisi na makambo yo ‘baaplication ya coronavirisi’ ekoki komema, Apple atie limit na baorganization oyo bakoki kotia application na App Store, kosukisa yango kaka na basali ya ‘’gouvernema’’ to baorganization misusu oyo eyebani makasi.
en-mt: Following concerns about the consequences of you 'coronavirus applications', Apple has limited the number of organizations that can upload applications to the App Store, limiting them to ''government'' employees or other well-known organizations.

sourceString: Google and Amazon have implemented similar restrictions.
targetString: Google na Amazon mpe ekotisi mibeko wana.
en-mt: Google and Amazon have also introduced these rules.

sourceString: Privacy campaigners voiced their concern regarding the implications of mass surveillance using coronavirus apps, in particular about whether surveillance infrastructure created to deal with the coronavirus pandemic will be dismantled once the threat has passed.
targetString: Bato yo bazila kobundela bonsoni ya kobomba ba sekekele ya bato mpona kokengela, bamituni soki bisika ya kosala mosala yango na ndenge ya malamu ezali mpe soki ekobebisama nsima ya coronavirisi
en-mt: People who have been fighting the shame of keeping people's secrets for protection have wondered if there are safe places to do this work and if they will be destroyed after the coronavirus

sourceString: Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issued a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: Amesty International baorganization misusu 100 babengi bato batia mibeko na bolandela bato oyo eko salema.
en-mt: Amesty International 100 other organizations have called for people to set rules and follow up on what will happen.

sourceString: The organisations declared eight conditions on governmental projects:
targetString: Baorganizations bakomaki batoli nsambo oyo gouvernema ekoki kolandela:
en-mt: The organizations wrote down seven recommendations the government can follow:

sourceString: surveillance would have to be "lawful, necessary and proportionate";
targetString: Kokengela esalema nakotosa ‘’mibeka mpe na ndenge y amalamu’’.
en-mt: Ensuring that it is done I will obey the ''laws and in a good way'

sourceString: extensions of monitoring and surveillance would have to have sunset clauses;
targetString: Esengeli ezala nan tango ya kosukisa kokengela;
en-mt: It must be nan time to end the surveillance;

sourceString: the use of data would have to be limited to COVID-19 purposes;
targetString: Mitango ekosalema kaka mpona COVID-19;
en-mt: Counts will be made for COVID-19 only;

sourceString: data security and anonymity would have to be protected and shown to be protected based on evidence;
targetString: Esengeli babetala makambo ya bato mpe bankombo na bango mpe esengeli balakisa te bazali kosala yango;
en-mt: They should check people's details and names and should not show that they are doing so;

sourceString: digital surveillance would have to avoid exacerbating discrimination and marginalisation;
targetString: Kokengela na ndenge ya ordinateur esalema na kati ya koyina basusu te ;
en-mt: Computerized surveillance is not conducted in the midst of hatred of others;

sourceString: any sharing of data with third parties would have to be defined in law;
targetString: Kokabola mitango na bato libanda ya mosala oyo esengeli episama na mibeko oyo ekomami;
en-mt: Distribution of figures to persons outside the workplace must be provided in writing;

sourceString: there would have to be safeguards against abuse and the rights of citizens to respond to abuses;
targetString: Esengeli ezala na ndenge ya kobatela bato ya mboka mpe kosunga soki moko amona mpasi mpona mosali oyo;
en-mt: It should be in a way that protects the community and helps if anyone suffers from this worker;

sourceString: meaningful participation by all "relevant stakeholders" would be required, including that of public health experts and marginalised groups.The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also issued checklists.
targetString: ‘’Moyo nyonso azala na kati ya mosala oyo’’ mpona ‘’bato’’ nyonso esengelami, mpe oyo ya basali ya kolongono ya bato mpe ba oyo bazali na bato ya kobatela bango te. German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) mpe na Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) mpe bakomaki ya bango batoli.
en-mt: ''Everyone should be involved'' for all ''people'' is required, including those of public health workers and the vulnerable. The German Chaos Computer Club (CCC) and Reporters Without Borders (Reporter ohne Grenzen) (RSF) also wrote their own recommendations.

sourceString: The proposed Google/Apple plan intends to address the problem of persistent surveillance by removing the tracing mechanism from their device operating systems once it is no longer needed.
targetString: Plan ya Google na ya Apple ekobenda matoyi na likambo ya kokengela oyo na kolongola system yango soki ntina na yango ezali lisusu te.
en-mt: Both Google and Apple's plan will address this oversight by removing the system when it is no longer needed.

sourceString: Some countries used network-based location tracking instead of apps, eliminating both the need to download an app and the ability to avoid tracking.
targetString: Bamboka misusu basalisaki kolanda bato na reseau kasi na application te, yango esengi te bato bazala na application mpe bakoki kokima ekengeli.
en-mt: Some countries have helped track people on the network but not on the application, which does not require people to have an application and can escape surveillance.

sourceString: In Israel, network-based tracking was approved.
targetString: Na Israel, kolandela na reseau endimamaki.
en-mt: In Israel, network monitoring was approved.

sourceString: Network-based solutions that have access to raw location data have significant potential privacy problems.
targetString: Kolandela na reseau oyo elakisi wapi moto azali ezali mpe kotia miso na makambo oyo esengeli te.
en-mt: Tracking on a network that means where someone is is also keeping an eye on things that shouldn’t be.

sourceString: However, not all systems with central servers need to have access to personal location data; a number of privacy-preserving systems have been created that use central servers only for intercommunication (see section below).

sourceString: Privacy-preserving contact tracing is a well-established concept, with a substantial body of research literature dating back to at least 2013.As of 7 April 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.

en-mt: Tracking is well known, with several etid since 2013. As of April 7, 2020, more than a dozen researchers were developing systems that will keep people safe, such as bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to notify a phone when it is nearby of the other.

sourceString: However, PEPP-PT is a co-ordination effort which contains both centralised and decentralised approaches, and is not a single protocol.Decentralised protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact Numbers (TCN, fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN), Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Mechanisms for Mobile Contact Tracing (PACT) and others.
targetString: Kasi, PEPP-PT ezali makasi ya mosala ya kati na ya libanda, mpe ezali na toli moko te ya kosalela yango. Ba protocol ya libanda ezali keloka Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact (TCN. fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN) Privacy Sensible Protocols na Mechanisms ya Kolandela bato na telephone.
en-mt: However, PEPP-PT is a strength of internal and external activity, and there is no recommendation for its use. External protocols include Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Proximity Tracing (DP-PPT/DP-3T), Temporary Contact (TCN. fka Contact Event Numbers, CEN) Privacy Sensitive Protocols and Telephone Tracking Mechanisms.

sourceString: In these protocols, identifiable personal data never leaves the device, and all matching happens on-device.

en-mt: With these protocols, no personal information will be revealed, and everything will be done over the phone.

sourceString: The Privacy Group at MIT Media Lab has been developing SafePaths, a platform for using privacy-preserving techniques when collecting and using location or path intersection data to track the spread of COVID-19.

sourceString: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, considerable scientific attention has been focused on repurposing approved anti-viral drugs that were developed for prior outbreaks such as MERS, SARS, and West Nile virus.
targetString: Lekola SARS-CoV-2 ezali virisi, ezalii kososolama makasi mpo esalema lisusu, ezali bakisi oyo basalelaki ntango ya pandemi ya MERS, SARS na virisi ya West Nile.
en-mt: Since SARS-CoV-2 is a virus, it is strongly understood to be reproduced, it is the drugs used during the MERS, SARS and West Nile virus pandemics.

sourceString: Ribavirin: ribavirin was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Ribavirin: ribavirin ezali malamu mpona COVID-19 nsima ya toli ya 7 ya Chine
en-mt: Ribavirin: ribavirin is effective for COVID-19 after China's 7th recommendation

sourceString: Umifenovir: umifenovir was recommended for COVID-19 treatment according to Chinese 7th edition guidelines
targetString: Umefenovir: Umifenovir ezali malamu mpona COVID-19 nsima ya toli ya 7 ya Chine
en-mt: Umefenovir: Umifenovir is effective for COVID-19 after China's 7th recommendation

sourceString: Some antibiotics that have been identified as potentially repurposable as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: Bakisi misusu mpe emonani malamu mpona kosalisa COVID-19:
en-mt: Other drugs have also been shown to be effective in treating COVID-19:

sourceString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved by China.
targetString: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Endimami na Chine.
en-mt: Tocilizumab (Anti-IL-6 receptor): Approved in China.

sourceString: Also trials in Italy and China. and see Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
targetString: Mpe komeka na Italie na Chine. Mpe mona Tocilizumab#COVID-19.
en-mt: And try in Italy and China. And see Tocilizumab#COVID-1

sourceString: b'A COVID-19 vaccine is a hypothetical vaccine against coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).
targetString: Vaccin ya b’COVID-19 ezali ya solo te mpona virisi ya 2019 (COVID-19).
en-mt: The vaccine is not true for the 2019 virus (COVID-19).

sourceString: Although no vaccine has completed clinical trials, there are multiple attempts in progress to develop such a vaccine.
targetString: Ata vaccin moko te eleki etap ya komeka, mosala mingi ezali kosalema mpona kosala vaccin oyo ekoleka.
en-mt: While no vaccine has passed the testing stage, much work is being done to develop a vaccine that will pass.

sourceString: In late February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it did not expect a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2, the causative virus, to become available in less than 18 months.
targetString: Na nsuka ya sanza ya mibale 2020, Organisation Mondial ya Sante (OMS) elobi bazalaki kozela vaccin ya SARS-CoV-2 te, virisi ya makambo, ezwama moke ya baposo 18.
en-mt: By the end of February 2020, the World Health Organization (WHO) said it was not expecting a vaccine for SARS-CoV-2, the virus of the events, to be available for less than 18 weeks.

sourceString: Five vaccine candidates were in Phase I safety studies in April.
targetString: Bavaccin mitano bazalaki na phase I ya na sanza ya minei.
en-mt: Five vaccines were in phase I of in April.

sourceString: COVID-19 was identified in December 2019.
targetString: COVID-19 emonanaki na sanza ya zomi na mibale 2019.
en-mt: COVID-19 was discovered in December

sourceString: A major outbreak spread around the world in 2020, leading to considerable investment and research activity to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Epanlanganaki makasi na mokili na 2020, esengaki mbongo mingi mpe baetid mpona kosala vaccin.
en-mt: It was widespread in the world by 2020, requiring a lot of money and time to develop a vaccine.

sourceString: Many organizations are using published genomes to develop possible vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: Baorganisation mingi bazali kosalisa bagenome oyo babimisaki mpona koluka vaccin ya SARS-CoV-2.
en-mt: Many organizations are using the genomes they have released to find a vaccine for SARS-CoV-2

sourceString: Stated in April, imperatives of the CEPI initiative for vaccine development are speed, manufacturing capacity, deployment at scale, and global access.
targetString: Balokaki na sanza ya minei, makasi ya CEPI ya koluka vaccin ezali mbango na bango, makasi ya kosala yango na ndenge ya monene, ya kotambwisa yango bisika mingi, mpe mpona mokili ezwa yango.
en-mt: They said in April that CEPI's strength in finding a vaccine is their speed, the strength to do it on a large scale, to run it in many places, and for the world to get it.

sourceString: In April, CEPI scientists reported that 10 different technology platforms were under research and development during early 2020 to create an effective vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Na sanza ya minei, bayekoli ya science ya CEPI balobaki ete ba ndenge ya technology 10 ezali kosalema na etid na ebandeli ya 2020 mpona kosala vaccin ya makasi ya kobundela COVID-19.
en-mt: In April, CEPI scientists said 10 technologies are being developed by early 2020 to develop a potent vaccine against COVID-1

sourceString: Major platform targets advanced into Phase I safety studies include:
targetString: Bisika mingi basibakomaki na phase I ya etid komona soki vaccin ezali malamu:
en-mt: Several places have reached phase I of etid to see if the vaccine is effective:

sourceString: nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
targetString: Acid ya nucleic (DNA na RNA) (Kobongisa ya phase I mpe candida ya vaccin: Moderna, mRNA-1273)
en-mt: Nucleic acid (DNA and RNA) (Phase I and candida preparation of vaccine: Moderna, mRNA-1273)

sourceString: viral vector (Phase I developer and vaccine candidate: CanSino Biologics, adenovirus type 5 vector)
targetString: ba vector ya viral (Phase I ya etid mpe candida: Biologie ya CanSino, adenovirus ya ndenge ya bavectir 5)
en-mt: viral vectors (Phase I of etid and candida: CanSino biology, vector-type adenovirus 5)

sourceString: As reported by CEPI scientists in April, 115 total vaccine candidates are in early stages of development, with 78 confirmed as active projects (79, according to the Milken Institute), and 37 others announced, but with little public information available (presumed to be in planning or being designed).
targetString: Ndenge bayekoli ya science ya CEPI elobi na sanza ya minei, 115 ya bavaccin bazalaki na ebandeli ya kosalema na 78 endimamaki lekola baprojets (79, elobi Insitu ya Milken), mpe 37 misusu, kasi bato bayebi mingi te na makambo yango (ezali kobongisama to ezali kosalema).
en-mt: As CEPI scientists said in April, 115 vaccines were in early development with 78 approved as projects (79, says Milken's Insitu), and 37 others, but little is known about them (being developed or is being done).

sourceString: A Phase I-II trial conducts preliminary safety and immunogenicity testing, is typically randomized, placebo-controlled, and at multiple sites, while determining more precise, effective doses.
targetString: Na phase I-II ya komeka bamonaka soki kisi ezali malamu mpe basalaka baekzame ya immune, esalemaka na bato ba mponami te, ba placebo ya kolandela, mpe bisika mingi, mpe koyeba, dose nini.
en-mt: In phase I-II trials they see if the drug is effective and do immune tests, done in unselected people, follow-up placebos, and multiple sites, and determine, what dose.

sourceString: Phase III trials typically involve more participants, including a control group, and test effectiveness of the vaccine to prevent the disease, while monitoring for adverse effects at the optimal dose.
targetString: Phase III ya komeka ezalaka na bato mingi mpe ekip ya kolandela yango, mpe baekzame ya komona soki kisi ezali kosimba na kopekisa maladi, nyonso na kolandela mosala ya dose oyo bapesi.
en-mt: A Phase III trial consists of a large number of subjects and a monitoring team, as well as trials to see if the drug is affected by disease control, all by monitoring the activity of a given dose.

sourceString: Of 79 vaccine candidates in active development (confirmed as of early April 2020), 74 were not yet in human evaluation (still in "preclinical" research).
targetString: Na bavaccin 79 oyo ezali kosalema uta ebandeli ya sanza ya minei 2020), 74 bakomaki na bato te (bazalaki kaka na komeka ya etid ya ‘clinic’).
en-mt: Of the 79 vaccines in development since early April 2020), 74 have not reached humans (they were only in 'clinical' trials).

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Australia, the University of Queensland announced that it is investigating the potential of a molecular clamp vaccine that would genetically modify viral proteins in order to stimulate an immune reaction.
targetString: Na Australie na mokolo ya 24 sanza ya liboso 2020, Universite ya Queensland elobaki ete ezali kososola soki molecule moko ya vaccin eko sala mosala na protein viral mpona kotumbola reaction ya immune.
en-mt: In Australia on January 24, 2020, the University of Queensland said it was investigating whether a vaccine molecule would work with a viral protein to boost the immune response.

sourceString: Around 24 January 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Centre (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced the commencement of work on a vaccine, aiming to start human testing in 2021.
targetString: Na sanza ya liboso mokolo ya 24 2020 na Canada, Esika ya International ya Bavaccin (VIDO-InterVac) na universite ya Saskatchewan elobaki ete babandaki mosala ya koluka vaccin, bakoki kobanda komeka na bato na 2021.
en-mt: On January 24, 2020 in Canada, the International Vaccine Center (VIDO-InterVac) at the University of Saskatchewan announced that it had begun research into a vaccine, with human trials likely to begin in

sourceString: Vaccine development projects were announced at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on 26 January 2020, and the University of Hong Kong on 28 January.
targetString: Misala ya koluka vaccin ebandaki na Esika ya kolandela mpe kopekisa bamaladi na Chinese na mokolo ya 26 sanza ya liboso 2020, mpe na universite ya hong kong sanza ya liboso mokolo ya 28.
en-mt: Vaccine research began at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention on January 26, 2020, and at the University of Hong Kong on January

sourceString: Around 29 January 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, led by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that it had begun work on developing a vaccine.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 29 sanza ya liboso 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, oyo mokonzi Hanneke Schuitemaker, balobaki ete babandaki mosala ya kosala vaccin.
en-mt: On January 29, 2020, Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies, headed by Hanneke Schuitemaker, announced that they had started work on the vaccine.

sourceString: Janssen is co-developing an oral vaccine with its biotechnology partner, Vaxart.
targetString: Janssen azali kosala vaccin ya komela na moninga na ye ya biotechnology, vaxart.
en-mt: Janssen is developing an oral vaccine with his biotechnology partner, vaxart.

sourceString: On 18 March 2020, Emergent BioSolutions announced a manufacturing partnership with Vaxart to develop the vaccine.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 18 sanza ya misato 2020, Emergent BioSolutions alobaki ye na moninga Vaxart bazali koluka vaccin.
en-mt: On March 18, 2020, Emergent BioSolutions said it and friend Vaxart were looking for a vaccine.

sourceString: On 8 February 2020, the laboratory OncoGen in Romania published a paper on the design of a vaccine with similar technology to the one used for cancer neoantigen vaccination therapy.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 8 sanza ya mibale 2020, laboratoire ya OncoGen na Romanie bakomaki manuskri na ndenge ya vaccin na technology moko oyo ezali kosalema mpona vaccin mpe kisi mpona cancer.
en-mt: On February 8, 2020, the OncoGen laboratory in Romania wrote a vaccine manuscript on a technology being developed for a vaccine and drug for cancer.

sourceString: On 25 March the head of the research institute announced that they had finalized the synthesis of the vaccine and were beginning the tests.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 25 sanza ya misato mokonzi na institu ya etid alobaki basilisaki synthese babandaki na ekzame.
en-mt: On March 25 the official at the etid institute said they finished the synthesis began with the examination.

sourceString: On 27 February 2020, a Generex subsidiary company, NuGenerex Immuno-Oncology, announced they were beginning a vaccine project to create an Ii-Key peptide vaccine against COVID-19.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 27 sanza ya mibale 2020, Companie moko ya moke ya Generex, NuGenerex Immuni-Ongologie, balobaki bazali kobanda projet ya vaccin kosala li-key peptide ya vaccin mpona COVID-19.
en-mt: On February 27, 2020, a Generex subsidiary, NuGenerex Immuni-Ongologie, announced it was launching a vaccine project to develop a li-key peptide vaccine for COVID-1

sourceString: They wanted to produce a vaccine candidate that could be tested in humans "within 90 days."
targetString: Balingaki basala candida ya vaccin oyo bakokaki komeka n abato’’na mikolo 90’’.
en-mt: They wanted to develop a vaccine candida that could be tested on people''in 90 days'

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, Washington University in St. Louis announced its projects to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 5 sanza ya misato 2020, universite ya Washington na St Louis balobaki babandaki mosala ya koluka vaccin.
en-mt: On March 5, 2020, Washington University in St Louis said it had begun the search for a vaccine.

sourceString: On 5 March 2020, the United States Army Medical Research and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research in Silver Spring, both in western Maryland, announced they were working on a vaccine.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 5 sanza ya misato 2020, Etid ya limpimgo mpona kolongono na Etats Unis mpe Materiel Command na Fort Detrick mpe Institu ya limpimgo ya Walter Reed, nyonso mibale na oust ya Maryland, balobaki bazali kosala vaccin.
en-mt: On March 5, 2020, the US Department of Health and Human Services and Materiel Command at Fort Detrick and the Walter Reed Institute of Health, both in eastern Maryland, said they were developing the vaccine.

sourceString: Around 10 March 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced that it had teamed with Novavax Inc.
targetString: Na 10 sanza ya misato 2020, Emergent Biosolutions elobaki kakomi kosala na Novavax Inc.
en-mt: On March 10, 2020, Emergent Biosolutions announced it was working with Novavax Inc. on March 10,

sourceString: in the development and manufacture of a vaccine.
targetString: Na koluka mpe kosala vaccin.
en-mt: In vaccine search and development.

sourceString: The partners further announced plans for preclinical testing and a Phase I clinical trial by July 2020.
targetString: Balobaki mpe bakobanda baekzame ya clinic mpe phase I ya komeka ya clinic na sanza ya nsambo 2020.
en-mt: They also said they would begin clinical trials and phase I clinical trials in July 2020.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, India's Health Ministry announced they are working with 11 isolates, and that even on a fast track it would take at least around one-and-a-half to two years to develop a vaccine.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 12 sanza ya misato 2020, Minister ya kolongono na Inde balobaki bazali kosala mosala na 11 ya mopanzi, mpe ata soki bazalaki kokende noki ekozwa bango moko na ndambo to bambula mibale mpona kosala vaccin.
en-mt: On March 12, 2020, the Health Minister in India said they were working on 11 sides, and even if they were going soon it would take themselves half or two years to develop the vaccine.

sourceString: On 12 March 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec, reported development of a coronavirus-like particle under partial funding from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 12 sanza ya misato 2020, Medicago, companie ya biotechnology na egumba ya Quebec, Quebec balobaki bazali kosala particle moko oyo ezali lekola ya coronavirisi na mbongo ndambo euti Institu ya Canada mpona etid ya kolongono.
en-mt: On March 12, 2020, Medicago, a biotechnology company in Quebec City, Quebec said it was developing a particle that mimics the coronavirus with funding in part from the Canadian Institutes of Health.

sourceString: The vaccine candidate is in laboratory research, with human testing planned for July or August 2020.
targetString: Vaccin ezali na etid ya laboratoire, bako banda komeka na bato na sanza ya nsambo to mwambe 2020.
en-mt: The vaccine is in laboratory etid, they will start testing in humans in July or August

sourceString: Earlier that week, The Guardian reported that the US President Donald Trump had offered CureVac "'large sums of money' for exclusive access to a Covid-19 vaccine", against which the German government protested.
targetString: Na ebandeli ya poso oyo, Guardian ereportaki ete Mokambi ya Etats Unis Donald Trump apesaki ‘CureVac’ mbongo ebele mpona kozwa vaccin ya COVID-19’’ gouvernema ya Germani atelemaki yango.
en-mt: Earlier this week, the Guardian reported that US President Donald Trump had offered 'CureVac' a large sum of money to develop a COVID-19 vaccine'' the German government opposed.

sourceString: On 17 March 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer announced a partnership with German company BioNTech to jointly develop a mRNA-based vaccine.
targetString: Na mokolo ya 17 sanza ya misato 2020, companie ya bakisi ya Amerik Pfizer elobaki bazali kosangana na company na Germany babengi BioNTech mpona kosala vaccin oyo euti na mRNA.
en-mt: On March 17, 2020, American pharmaceutical company Pfizer said it was partnering with a German company called BioNTech to develop an mRNA-based vaccine.

sourceString: mRNA-based vaccine candidate BNT162, currently in pre-clinical testing with clinical trials expected to begin in April 2020.
targetString: BNT162 candida ya vaccin oyo euti na mRNA, ezali na ekzame ya clinic eoyo ekobanda sanza ya minei 2020.
en-mt: BNT162 candida mRNA-derived vaccine, is in clinical trial ewhich will start April

sourceString: In Italy on 17 March 2020, Takis Biotech, an Italian biotech company announced they will have pre-clinical testing results in April 2020 and their final vaccine candidate could begin human testing by fall.
